Bwqh9-sea8dyxPAIs-TnyQ.text: We came into the Waldhorn at about 2:15 pm on July 2 and had a really weird, unpleasant experience. We were starving and I talked my bf into trying this place, I had eaten there once years ago. When we walked in, a very young waitress was at the hostess stand. We said, '2 for lunch'. She looked bewildered or shocked and then showed us to a booth. Soon after an older waitress, then another came out, almost as if they were all circling us to inform that we could not eat because lunch was over and dinner service didn't start until 3 pm. We were like, um, what? Why did she seat us? Then another chimed in that the buffet was still open did we want to eat that... it was all very bizarre, unprofessional and untoward. Needless to say we won't be back and definitely do not recommend.

s0kmUCHBiZzVco00xvbsSA.text: I was really excited about trying Waldhorn. I always forget about it because it's tucked away in Pineville. From the outside it looks really cool. You'd think that the inside would match the outside's appeal, Well it doesn't. I walked in & was surprised to find a very plain setting. BRIGHT lighting, stark white walls, and light brown wood... It's not romantic at all. It looks like a retirement home at night, but uncomfortable.  We started with the beef carpaccio & the potato pancakes with applesauce. Beef carpaccio is one of my all time favorite appetizers, so I was excited. They ruined it. It would've been delicious, but they soaked it in dressing, ruining the texture & flavor. However, the potato pancakes were bomb! It's kinda hard to screw up potato sand applesauce... But hey it was good.  My boyfriend & I spit the jagerschnitzel. IT COMES WITH MUSHROOMS. They do not list this on the menu so if you don't like mushrooms, you've been warned. We picked off the mushrooms ordered a side of the brown sauce (Much better than the Hunter's sauce) and it was very good. Haha it took work but it was good. The red cabbage was delicious.  Now for the only reason this place didn't receive 2 stars instead of 3, their bread pudding is sooooo good, and a great portion.   This is a once a year place for me. I'm really not impressed at all. There are too many excellent places in Charlotte with better atmospheres to do anything halfway.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Amazing bread pudding
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Potato Pancakes &amp; apple sauce
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. The Carpaccio had wayyyyy too much dressing!

C3LiwLpNyU0_RAOaXB0S9Q.text: I've given them 2 chances 2 years apart. They suck go to the one in Black Mountain. Food is overpriced, slow loitering staff.

bsURqDGOTBFfhg6vDWQ3XA.text: I love this place... legit. I've been going to the Waldhorn since the day it opened its doors, and yes, I'm just now getting around to write about it (don't judge me). The owners are from Germany, hard working, and put there hearts and soul in this place. So what specifically do I like about this place? Everything, from the authentic Schwaben (not Bavarian, don't say this to Frau Muller, the owner!) cuisine (the Rinds roladian is my absolute favorite) to the pretzel rolls they serve at dinner (ask for a side of mustard, which is German, to dip your pretzel bread into, it just may change your life). The wait staff is friendly and knowledgeable. Some other highlights about this place? The Sunday brunch is amazing (think German meets American Fare and had a baby, it's delish) the annual Octoberfest is fun, you can spend your time either inside the restaurant or outside in the tents. Oh, and did I mention the beer?? Yeah, a full assortment of actual beer from Germany, try the Spaten Octoberfest on tap, AMAZING! Oh, and little known fact... if you go during Christmas season (December 1st till Christmas) ask your bartender and or wait staff for the Christmas Stollen. It's an authentic German fruitcake that is made fresh by the owners themselves. Also, on certain days of the week, they have live music (an old guy playing an accordion) who's actually entertaining. We've bought him shots many times, he'll play just about anything for you. The Waldhorn is one of my go to places in the Charlotte area.

5BbuTK24jJGTRZBh5E9igA.text: This did NOT compare to Germany (in MY opinion). But in all fairness, I can't say the food was BAD. It was pretty good. My husband had the sausage sampler. I had the Jager schnitzel and my kids had the chicken nuggets (damn kids) Out server, Kristen was supper attentive and sweet. A little pricey for what you get  I would probably not spend the money to go back but I'm really happy I went. I love trying different places to eat. It was a really nice experience.

i035rFQnZBZYyTJALkowXA.text: Well if you like German food and are in the Charlotte area....come here! My family is from Germany. We vacation there, and I have to say this food is pretty good for being in the states. I would recommend their Sunday brunch buffet because you get to try so many amazing things. My favorite dish they offer is the weiner schnitzel.

EepWm6XFs2awEmn1Sf4mzA.text: Wonderful atmosphere, service, and food. I have dined here, once for dinner, and once for the Sunday brunch buffet. Dinner will provide you with the more authentic culinary experience, as well as slightly more attentive service--and, possibly, some live German music. The brunch buffet is no less enjoyable but the focus is on the breadth of offerings. All I can say is, "Pace yourself."  Pro tip: If you are seated for brunch before noon, order coffee and start with the dessert trays. (You're going to eat them anyway. No point in delaying the inevitable for mere social conventions.) Take your time savoring them; there's a lot. Next, have a few breakfast items (french toast, bacon, omelettes) but not too much. Then, by time you make it to the lunch dishes (spaetzle, German potato salad, rotkohl, jagerschnitzel, sauerbraten, roast beef) it will hopefully be a few minutes after 12:00 and the town elders will allow you to order a German draft beer to finish off your delicious meal.

3oGCyDjVNgRcjpWodvsS9Q.text: Olde German Schnitzel Haus, our local award winning Germany restaurant, closed at the end of August.   I found no less than three German restaurants, while searching on Yelp, and oddly enough they were all exactly one hour from Hickory:  (1) "Berliner Kindl German Restaurant" in Black Mountain. (Bookmarked) (2) "The German Restaurant" in Yadkinville. (Fantastic, but sadly, now closed as well!) (3) "Waldhorn Restaurant" in Pineville.   I have had Waldhorn on my "to try list" seemingly forever, so I headed toward Pineville for lunch.  The exterior of the restaurant was beautiful to me. It gave me the impression that I was in for something special. I didn't bother to take any photos because there are already so many on Yelp. The interior is virtually the same as every other German restaurant that I've ever visited, and that's okay with me.  I had every intention of ordering German sausages, sauerkraut, fried potatoes, and German beer, but they had a dish on the lunch menu that sounded appetizing. It was a veal dish with sauteed mushrooms in a brown gravy atop Spatzle, accompanied by sauteed vegetables. This dish sounded good to me so I changed my mind at the last minute. It was delicious, but it was very plain Jane looking, so I didn't take any photos.   I was seated immediately, but it took a good ten minutes for the young male bartender to stop talking golf and NASCAR before he pulled my Spaten lager. When he did get around to his duties, he did a very good job. In a word: perfect pour.  Note: Spaten brewery was started in the year 1397, and it is delicious beer!  This was by far the best German beer that I've ever had, and of course it paired perfectly with German cuisine. I found it to also be deceptively potent.   The Spaten Oktoberfest beer was fantastic as well!  I enjoyed Waldhorn, and it was well worth the hour's drive. This is a great German restaurant, which I highly recommend.

uyHMbN4xzf85YQ0niHGNSQ.text: what kind of restaurant doesn't serve dinner on sunday...what a joke this place is...drove all the way down from concord too... working people have two damn days per week for things like eating out and this place doesn't even serve dinner on one of those two days...i hope this place goes out of business.

o5SJLXSs8h1VG_YMnL9niA.text: Solid German food.  Great sauerkraut.  A guy roams around playing the accordion and when we asked for the Pennsylvania Polka he said..."you mean the Steelers Fight Song?"  Yes!!!  That's exactly what we mean!  haha.  Outside of the restaurant is really nice, but inside is a little bit of a let down.  Decor could be updated, and with the accordion player a little kitschy, but plenty of room for groups and a fun, interesting evening.  A small bar with TV's.  Service was good.

Sjtc8THSLDPVQB_7ozxT-g.text: Excellent German food and amazing drinks. Waiter was very informative and they had a large menu of options.

Ir6zbjVpYgRtyYTQsd7-bQ.text: What a gem to find.  All the customers are repeat locals, which says something. If you want a schnitzel this is the place to go. Convenient to the highway, and worth a detour.

QnfsHPpcWdCuxA0Uz2LUuQ.text: Today we took advantage of another beautiful mid-winter day, sunny and 72 degrees, to drive down to Pineville, NC, and visit our favorite German Restaurant on February 19th.  Every  Sunday they have a buffet until 2:30 pm so it gave us plenty of time to get here after attending Early Church and Sunday School.  Of course that meant battling either the construction on I-85 or I-77, you get a choice.  We have been to the Waldhorn many times, and have brought business groups here when meeting in the area as well, and normally have nothing but rave reviews for this restaurant.  Unfortunately today was an exception, at least I hope it was.  When we arrived at about 1:00 pm there was plenty of parking, but you could tell from where the cars were parked that a much bigger crowd had been here earlier.  When we arrived we were seated about as far from the buffet line as you can be and still be inside.  I commented to Mary, that will help me eat more as I can walk it off on the trips back and forth.  I noticed a number of tables along the way to where we were seated that were not bussed yet and several that had been cleared.  We waited at the table for several minutes to give a server our drink order before heading to the buffet, and as soon as he left another server appeared and wanted to take our drink order.  She appeared a bit surprised that someone else had already taken it.  From that point on it appeared that neither of them was sure who was to service our table, and unfortunately for most of our time there, neither did.  My iced tea glass remained empty for most of the meal, even though I placed it at the edge of the table where they could easily see it, and both of them were servicing other tables around us.  Even looking our way a number of times.  I tried to get their attention without shouting several times unsuccessfully.  Finally, as we were eating our desserts, one of them asked if I wanted more iced tea!    I truly believe in tipping well for good service, even as high as 35%.  But I will also reduce the tip from 20% when the service is not what it should be.  And that occurred this time.  While we go to this restaurant 6-8 times a year (it is about a 200 mile round trip) it is not enough to be called regulars.  And obviously there were regulars in our seating area and you could tell by the level of service they received and the familiarity between the customers and wait staff.  One time the waiter went to get the iced tea at for the table right next to us and yet didn't come to our table to re-fill our drinks.  As I stated before, this is not the type of service I am accustomed to getting at the Waldhorn in the many years we have been coming.  And, I did make the mistake of not saying anything to the management team before we left.  And while the service was less than acceptable, the buffet it self was not well maintained.  Twice dishes were not available at a station, and refilling the buffet items was very slow.  What food there was available was enjoyable, thus the 3 stars instead of lower.  If this had been my first visit the score would have been lower and I am not sure I would return.  I truly hope this visit was an anomaly!

uidvPivxToWRJhIoSa0kvQ.text: We went the last Saturday of their 2016 Octoberfest. it was our first time going. I read prior reviews about getting there early or you don't get a seat and that is True. We arrived at @ 6:30pm and though the lines for tickets and food/beverages were short(ish) there was no place to sit. A short while after arriving we got food and drinks for the 10 of us. Suddenly 4 seats together opened up. We let the ladies in our party sit to eat. Us guys went out the back of the tent and sat on the hill on the ground and the kids in our group ran around in the woods and surrounding grounds. I would estimate that there were at least 500 people under the tent, however they only had 3 portable toilets. By 8:00pm you could not move under the tent and the lines were very long for everything. We left @ 9:15 pm.  TIP 1: If you like to drink beer, buy it by the pitcher which is $18 for @ 4.5 glasses vs. $6 per glass individually.  TIP 2: Eat before arriving. While the food was good, it is expensive.   TIP 3: If you arrive early you'll find the closest parking  TIP 4: By 9:00 PM most of the early crowd leaves and the seats open up.  TIP 5: The band plays in the tent and it is very LOUD!!!!  TIP 6: If you want to eat in the restaurant first, make reservations WAY IN ADVANCE! We tried a week in advance and they were booked.  NOTE to Waldhorn's ... provide some 'stand up' tables outside of the tent, maybe  @20 so folks can place their drinks and food down!!!! Provide more port-a-johns too ....  Other than that, we had a good time and we'll  definitely be back !!!!!!!

ZqJDqr7m7LQCoXvmuHJrmQ.text: I ate here last night and ordered an "off the menu dish."  It was absolutely awesome.  Unfortunately I do not remember the name of the meal except it was a variation of a pizza.  I know it's a German restaurant.  The liter steins of beer are also the greatest.  I would recommend this little gem to anyone in the area.  Oh yeah be sure to get the pretzel rolls.  They are a great starter.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Something extremely tasty

9wYiSGklVGIzmTxSX7NX_Q.text: This is a fantastic place to eat authentic German food. The wait staff is very professional and the food is stellar. It's also a lot of fun when Octoberfest comes around in late September. That have beer tents and music out back.

zEtnaRk29Uvqwoj2GO3LhA.text: Up here in Pineville for work and had to come visit this place. Very authentic German cuisine. They are closed on Mondays. The atmosphere is nice. The beer is even better. If you're ever up this way, this is a must visit for Authentic German did.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Black Forest cake... damn good!
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Jaeger schnitzel reminded me of being back in Germany. Very authentic.
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Sausage sampler was amazing!

dMZ6mK7n8aNyiF9aaWxhMw.text: Came here for lunch and ordered the "Wienerschnitzel" vow Schwein ($10.95) and it was wonderful. It was served with warm red cabbage and spatzle. I was apparently very hungry and didn't have a single bite to take home. The breaded pork was amazing and had some sauce underneath. It was a great choice and it would be hard to get anything else with how good that was. Also, the pretzel rolls only come with dinner, but are available if you ask and are only 50 cents each. Totally worth it! Good beer selection, of course. If you are in the area, this is a great lunch and/or dinner spot.

rIK5FzruyLNtUyizx5nweg.text: My first time here.  My son recommended that my wife and I give this place a try.  So we did and my son and daughter came along for the trip.  My son had the Veal Weinerschnitzel, wife and daughter had the pork tips with spaitzel and I the two different bratwurst with kraut and home fries.  We all enjoyed the food, very flavorful!  We also had the potato cakes as an appetizer, with applesauce and was also very good.  We will definitely come again!  Went at lunch time, so not very busy.  They close at 3 to prep for dinner, we were in around 1:30 and out around 2:30.  Their beer selection is very German oriented.  The Hefeweizen was awesome!  Highly recommend it if you like German cuisine!  By the way, the red cabbage was out of this world!  Did not expect the flavor, it is a must when you go!

63ErowFUiAk_BNmgUV3-TQ.text: This restaurant had amazing and authentic German food.  Gita and her staff provided great service, and it was clear by the crowd that it's a local favorite.  Many thanks to Gita, co-owner, for mailing me back the credit card I left there!  Something you can only get from a great family owned restaurant like Waldhorn.

YwASWweFCRiBAgF-uGPNYQ.text: Excellent for Sunday brunch!  They have a good selection of breakfast and lunch items for just $15.95.  Some of our favorites were:  fresh-made omelets, crispy bacon, cheese grits, spaetzle, a variety of sausages, seafood Alfredo, sliced beef, and the desserts.  The coffee was also delicious and strong.  Service was great, and we did not feel rushed to leave.  The only warning is that they are extremely crowded between 11am and noon.  If you can hold off until after noon, the lines will be much better.  This one's a keeper!

xxBUni_68k1KUjWHWEtCAg.text: Have been looking for a great German restaurant for years and found on while on a work assignment in Charlotte. With my wife visiting we went here for dinner. Having german food while growing up, standards were high to meet expectations set by my mother's cooking. We both had the sauerbraten with red cabbage and spetzel.  The meat was obviously marinated in wine, vinegar and spices for several days (waitress told me 6 days) because it was both tender and very tasty. I have had sauerbraten in other restaurants and all they did was flavor the gravy and not take the time to marinate the meat.  Had the strudel for dessert which also great warm with a side of ice cream.  Do not forget to try one of the beers. Great assortment of german beers. Looking forward to returning and trying other dinners!

ldJOAheO84lN1-iB0nC-Tw.text: The young lady at the front desk was very professional to all customers even though some customers were not.  Incident taken on this date at 18:32 hours.

4aHae9ktjCmRAnjoDacCRw.text: Everytime I'm in the area I stop here.  Great selection of German Beers.  Staff could not be more welcoming and friendly.  Schnitzel, red cabbage, potato pancakes are excellent.  If you are not filled by the end of the meal the black forest cake is a can't miss.

a7bHbpo_x9RjRvvg8dqmVw.text: Went to this place when I had some family in town for the Sunday brunch buffet.  The food was pretty decent.  My grandpa is from Germany and my mom often made German food for us growing up.  It wasn't exactly like my mom's but I thought it was pretty good compared to other German places I have tried.  I was not impressed with the lay out of the buffet.  Kind of had to stand in an awkward line where people weren't really sure where they were going or who was in line and who wasn't.    I would have loved to see Rouladen on the buffet as that is one of my favorites...I know they have it on the regular menu though.

OmMazPXda3AFMnuytMQvMw.text: Wish Charlotte had more German eateries. Waldhorns is good, especially the brunch on Sundays,, but I have had better.

tddgg-9ujkzJN6xtP2N5QQ.text: When ever I travel for business I always seek out non-chain restaurants. I had eaten at Waldhorn a few years ago. Finding myself back in the Charlotte area and having a few hours to kill before a flight back to New Jersey, I ventured over to the Waldhorn Restaurant for some lunch. The staff was very welcoming and attentive. Since I was dining solo I decided to sit at the bar. They have a great selection of German beer.  The menu has a wonderful selection of southern German dishes. I began with the home made Maultaschen soup. The German ravioli was flavorful with meat and spinach filling. Served in a nice beef broth it was the perfect starter. For my entree I had the prime rib sandwich with German potato salad. Followed by a wonderful strudel for dessert. If you find yourself in the Charlotte area and are looking for some wonderful German cooking pay a visit to Waldhorn Restaurant and you won't be disappointed.

GkTPxKiErj4J3NQgHpfsZQ.text: Excellent service and the most delicious food! The waitstaff is very attentive and friendly and the manager Brian is awesome. My husband compares the kartoffelpuffer to the potato pancakes that his mom or grandmother would make - very authentic. They have a great selection of German beers and wines. The sauerbraten and gegrillter lachs are two of my favorite entrees. I also highly recommend the rindsrouladen and the schnitzel. The portion sizes are very generous; I always had leftovers to take home. The apfelstrudel is a must for dessert. While living in the Charlotte area, we ate here at least once every week or two. Hands down best and most authentic German restaurant I have ever eaten at.

iUN4CgFon1n7pxnwle054Q.text: When I exit my car last night, I felt almost like in Munich. Building both outside and inside looks as European as it gets around here. 12 kinds of German beer on tap caused my frist explosion of joy and then it got even better. We ordered four different dishes, each and every one prepared exactly as it would be back home. My orange duck was particularly impressive, especially with extra sauerkraut on the side. Very nice service convinced me to come back soon, maybe for Sunday brunch 'all you can eat', even if only to try all the remaining menu positions at once. I have to consider moving closer to this place and get my Beer Club membership.

5ha4tvtRdIgoUZ33EzIlOQ.text: Used to be so good...but the food and service has deteriorated in the last few years.  Carpaccio....one of my favorite items on their menu is now served without toast points. You must request them...then they only bring a few. Last time it was served on a very hot plate...by the time we got the toast, some if the carpaccio was cooked. Horrible.  I have enjoyed the venison dish in the past...it was always tender and succlent. Last visit, it was so rare and chewey I could not enjoy it. I asked the waitress about it, and she replied, "They've always cooked it rare".   The crab cakes: I know that most German menus probably don't include crab cakes! But, most nice restaurants do, so it is pretty standard fare. Their crab cakes are very crabby, but also include either tuemeric or curry, which is entirely unexpected, and does not add to the dish.  Their famous salad: The Waldhorn salad, baby greens towering over delicious cucumber salad, orzo salad, carrot salad and delicious german potato salad. This dish is just amazing! For us, it is the only reason to return to Waldhorn's!  Bring your own water, service is spotty most times....and I've observed that we aren't always the only ones with empty glasses!  We've liked Waldhorn for over 10 years....but this weekend was probably our last visit.

enIZ8Q91RCVQrIpsSbsYHA.text: I have never had a bad meal here and the beer selection here is best for German style beers.   I'm not a big fan of most ales and girly-man beers so this place is a win-win.  Servers and bartenders are always on top of their game.  I will return whenever I'm in the area.

elH7lmrIpBNG_N0ewihmvg.text: Maybe I just don't like German food but was very unhappy with all the food I tasted. It could have been what I ordered? I was disappointed with the selection of food as well. I ordered a Chicken Salad Sandwich and it had way too much sauce on it. My husband let me try a bite of his Rueben which was really good. My kid's loved the authenticity of the restaurant which made it worth it to see them so happy. I wouldn't choose to go back but I am guessing it's probably b/c German food isn't my thing.

K8TxXqnBtNLaAoMkWm9-IQ.text: Outstanding, first time eating there and cannot wait to go back already. Food was outstanding, our waiter was very knowledgable and the environment perfect.

cy8Nib08Ku9SRBhTRXS3EA.text: Absolutely amazing meal every time. The best beer, food, and ambiance. A must do in Charlotte!!! Yummy

UNMKIWZmfq8psNCRG5Wssw.text: The Waldhorn is a great places to go for Octoberfest. The wait can be long but the large outside tent with a live Braverian band and hundred of other people having a ball makes you in no rush for dinner. After two leaders of Beer I don't remember much about the food:)

Ak8FuIxHlVEyAMDPR5AlWw.text: Great food a staff that knows the food and menu. The Beer club is the best thign going in the area after a tueday at work. Close your eyes and open them quick and your in Germany. Beer selections for the real beer drinkers, go in and get a liter of some good germany brews.

Z9EbcP3L5Mt7KR5O1Zc3ug.text: Out of all the things to have at a great German restaurant, I had the trout and it was great! Cute place! A local friend recommended it and I was not disappointed.

1L1GxEriT5otwhJYq_Tt0Q.text: This place is delicious. Its not cheap. I can't seem to recall where the owners are from.   Lunch time is about the best time to go to this place. The lunch specials are still on the high end, but they don't suffer in quality. Unfortunately, I cannot attest to anything but how delicious the weinerschntizel is. I can't seem to bring my self to try anything else. However, the portions could be a little larger.   In the evening, they serve soft and warm pretzel rolls with the meal. They are also delicious. This is one of the best German places that I've been to in the US.   The Oktoberfest is not something to be messed with. They pull off the more traditional approaches. Its a tent, and its well managed. There are complaints about the whole ticket system. But given NC/US's weird alcohol rules, they make it work.

BUKSLr-tU5NyuhKQondUyQ.text: Dined here June 2014.  I had a saugage/brautwurst combination plate, which was excellent.  The decor is nothing to write home about.  The service was good.

2wpQKZZD77Ujl6m3s-rUjA.text: OMG Love their beer, beer glasses, beer steins!  The food is a little wierd to me but they let me hang out for hours!  The waiter was awesome and very informative and knowledgable about the food selection and describing it to me. Well educated staff. Just kinda weird food.

hTBs2q0Mwb3AOEYi2zvnSg.text: My credentials:  I was born in Germany, lived for years in Germany, my mom (the best cook ever) was German, and I currently run a US business selling German Food.  I love this restaurant and visit every time I travel through Charlotte.  Their Roasted Duck is a thing of beauty (succulent with crispy skin..and a sauce that is sweet but not overwhelming).  I have a wheat allergy and the wait staff and chef went out of their way to steer me away from anything bad-for-me.  All 9 in our party this last time (July 10, 2010) were delighted with the food.  Not a single complaint.  They came in 10th in the nation in a competition for the Best German Restaurant in America (see  BestGermanRestaurant. com) and I'm already looking forward to dining there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Fun place for good food and Geuetlichkeit.

-RMurcdfWnCVUKfwGRGFRQ.text: We went last night for Queen's Feast (Restaurant week).  Had a fabulous meal with a fabulous waiter.  He was super knowledgable.  All food is homemade which is rare these days.  For $30 you got a wine or beer, appetizer (we had the salad and it was different and yet so good).   Then an entree; I had the chicken with mushroom sauce and rice pilaf.  It was delicious and enough for two meals.  The pretzel rolls..... they are phenomenal and made fresh daily.  Dessert also included, one which we shared and the 2nd we took home.  All the food was just fantastic.  I've been wanting to go here for years and it did not disappoint.  Red cabbage was fabulous; and all the entrees my dining partners had were very, very good.  We love this place and will definitely be back!

_KZOBb6baCyJ-U4eh6jlOQ.text: One of our favorite restaurants!  Been there many times for Sunday brunch, beer club Tuesdays and special occasions.  Most recently we stopped by for the Charlotte restaurant week special.  This is a really good deal as they have many more selections than any other restaurant and offer 4 courses instead of 3.  Everything is great but I highly recommend trying the Ungarische Gulaschsuppe, like the best beef stew ever.  The brunch is also something everyone should experience.  The omelets are amazing and the beef tenderloin carving station just takes it over the top.  There is a huge selection of items with lots of German items to choose from.

WsUsV68VJxrLBRr7QnS1oQ.text: Although I use Yelp constantly, I've never been compelled to contribute my own review. After such a great experience at Waldhorn, I'm ready. I'm no expert on German food, but my husband and I have been to Germany and Austria and absolutely loved the food. I surprised him with a birthday meal at Waldhorn and it not only lived up to, but exceeded our hopes. The food was excellent and we had great service- we'll definitely be returning.

V8sbNuKuKyqcPg3lfiND7w.text: Having been in Charlotte only a year, I'd despaired of finding good German cuisine in the QC.  Turns out you have to go to Pineville.  Also turns out it's well worth the drive.  The Waldhorn is a little kitschy, but appropriately so.  Their tap selection is well-chosen and good.  The rolls are pretzel-y and fantastic.  The sauerkraut is sauer enough, though they do the sweet caraway-seed version.  The wurst is the best in Charlotte.  (Please don't kill me.)  We started with the wurst plate, served with mustard, sauerkraut and rolls.  There was plenty, and I should've stopped there, but I hadn't had good German food in a while, and was in a celebratory mood.  I had the jagerschnitzel.  It was made entirely of food.  Pork was thin, crispy and delicious.  Red cabbage was firm and sweet.  Spatzle needed salt, but it usually does.  Heated up well the next day, also--there was a lot of it.  She had the venison.  Sweet lord.  That is all.  An older gentleman in liederhosen and wielding an accordion played throughout the place, but never so loud as to be distracting.  I like the accordion though, so your mileage may vary.  It is a little pricier than I would've liked, but I don't think that is going to stop me from going back.  Regularly.

-optuXNoaaLHqo_BCg83LA.text: I am a beer club member and every time I come to Charlotte for work I make sure to show up at least once during the week.  I never had German food in Germany, but I have gone with some co-workers that have and they say that this place is as authentic as it gets.

LBIHbILNRohOD8DE3cFe5g.text: Great restaurant. Has a mug club that is worthwhile if you go here a lot. Their food is great, especially the pretzel rolls you get.  The beer selection is vast.  Oktoberfest is a great time as well. A polka band plays while you eat and enjoy authentic German food.

phSQAxmqvvyaWsYTe0Nirw.text: The service was great and the food was even better! I had Jagerschnitzel with s tell cold German lager. Great place and I will be back!

nNTdzRb_17AaP8WqpbwhWw.text: Stopped in here yesterday because traffic was overwhelming!!! Glad I did.. I highly recommend this place. Amazing management, bartender, food and Beer. Let just say this is my new little pit stop afterwork!!! Came back the next day after work!!! Hmm must be good if you come back the next day!!! Just saying!!

VybOIvqOi-marFU4dG4h3w.text: Tonight was my first time here, and I think I'm in love. The beer selection is fantastic (you had me at Weihenstepher), the service was great, and the food was really, really good. I ordered the Wurst Platte, which, as it's name suggests, is a plate of sausages--three different kinds, to be exact, with a side of kraut and home fries. There was also a perfect dribbling of jaeger sauza to go with it. I've always like kraut, but not loved it. This stuff, I loved. It actually had a slightly sweet flavor to counteract the normal tang of kraut. My wife had a pork schnitzel that was flayed and stuffed with black forest ham and cheese. Nothing better than stuffing pork with pork, my friends. That was served with a side of spaetzle and broccoli that was actually fresh.   The old timer walking around playing the accordian was a nice touch and got everyone going. There were a lot of large parties, but we were seated quickly and also served quickly. The location is a little out of the way for a Charlottean, but well worth the trip if you find yourself south of town.

0XIPp3GE3h0vkptTqQpVEQ.text: Best dinner of our trip.  Great german food.  The pretzel rolls were amazing, as was the service.  One of the few places I have seen venison on the menu.  We had to try it and weren't disappointed.  Our group also had the stuffed pork (breaded pork tenderloin, stuffed with ham and cheese) and a sampler platter.  The stuffed pork and the (sweet) red cabbage were the highlights of the meal.

_H11MDmKgzam8SbnDnisCw.text: For 9 years, i have lived only 3 miles away from the best brunch in town. I just realized this a day ago.  Made to order omelets, roast beef carving station,  salad/soup, potato salad, brats, sausages, pork, pretzel rolls, bacon, more pork, veggies, french toast, grits and other normal breakfast fare, rice, pasta, chicken, apple/cherry cobbler, tons of deserts....oh my the deserts. Everything was very very good. It was very hard to force myself to stop eating and when we left i could barely move. Some may think its a little pricey but at $17/ per person it is way worth it for the selection and quality of food. Another great thing is that its not predominantly just breakfast foods. There is something for everyone. I thought the service was awesome. Our server and the guys at the roast beef/omelet station all told me about their Oktoberfest and encouraged me to attend. Guess i look like i really dig beer (well, it's True).  I'm not sure what additionally i can say that previous reviews haven't already said...ill just echo that if you haven't been to this brunch yet-your definitely missing out!

zLWHRodXJCNjZ3rfzb3y2w.text: Best German food and beer this side of Germany! Pilsners, pretzel rolls and schnitzel, oh my! Plan to have a couple beers at the bar before dinner. They have several German beers on tap. The food is delicious, we usually end up getting the schnitzel (breaded pork cutlet, stuffed with black forest ham and swiss cheese),  and the duck, of course with spaetzle or bread dumplings. Prepare to embarrass yourself when your party of two inevitably asks for another basket of pretzel rolls, they're that good. This is the epitome of comfort food and will absolutely wreck your diet, but I can at least promise you it will be worth it. The staff are great, you feel like you're dining in someone's very large German home. It's a special night out kind of place, with entrees $15-20. I have no complaints about this place except its not closer to my house.

HowjkF5qkHDkpulH4vVCzg.text: They serve spaten Oktoberfest year round! Great brots, potato pancakes, and pretzel bread!

9tQvmZB02QGjEl3Zm6Z7Vw.text: Great food buffet for lunch. Their pretzel rolls are to die for.  Great snitle and sausage sampler

j420mMhIcSGfeOQtPwPJYQ.text: Delicious and authentic German food.  The pretzel rolls are awesome, and the four entrees at our table were all wonderful. It was nice to be able to exchange some of the side dishes which came with the entrees.  The service was attentive but not overbearing.  We drove from the Hickory area to try the Waldhorn, and it was well worth the trip.

pQb73UlLs03UNQjXDupXZw.text: If you enjoy German food, then this is the absolute BEST place in the area.  They have pretzel dough rolls that are just the bomb!  Lets also not forget to mention the copious amounts of awesome imported German beer!!

0PvSEmTtQkV3Fw3lfupj7A.text: One of the best German restaurants in the country.  Great beer selection. Everything I've tried is excellent. Service is excellent. This is my favorite restaurant of all time. You won't be disappointed.

dKz6PDPTXpb-WrcprjH8iA.text: OMG! Why or why have I never been here before now. This place is awesome, in so many ways. First the atmosphere was perfect. A very casual feel. There's a bar that you can walk up to sit down order a great pint of beer. Second the waitstaff is extremely knowledgeable. Third the food all my God is so good.  The portion sizes are great. We will be going back definitely.

S7LGTVsGnqFU7TmpODcaOw.text: This is where the birthday girl wanted to go last night so this is where we went.  Best surprise - a free slice of Black Forest cake with the purchase of any two dinner entrees.  This is the Tuesday special and it's large enough for two to share.  Table ordered the wienerschnitzel, sauerbrauten and chicken nadia.  Three entrees, two glasses of wine, one large draft beer, a cup of coffee and the free Black Forest cake ran $80 including tip.

tDKrig-ixlWGsTUvoVgMfQ.text: Delicious German food...great service. Excellent Sunday brunch and the atmosphere is very cheerful and authentic.

SNMr7kvyDPmy56RIOGWknQ.text: Went to the buffet and it was okay. They had a variety of foods but it was all mediocre. Not worth the cost.

s6aDmfP5VyXgYoY5qQ4mHw.text: First time for me and my dining mates at this German restaurant. I have a strong German heritage and exposed to many German foods.  The staff was very friendly and attentive. Dinner time and  it was a very noisy atmosphere overall. We sat in a comfortable booth.  We ordered sauerbraten that came with red cabbage and spatzle, the Waldhorn house salad ( greens with some German potato salad, orzo  and carrot salad), soup of the day, a mushroom soup and rib eye steak with mushroom and onions in a brown sauce with vegetable and potato.  Food was plated nicely. Sauerbraten was a very dry pot roast consistency so we asked for more of the extra sauce which I personally have had better. The meat  did not seem  to well marinated to us. We were disappointed with this and would not reorder again. Spatzle was bland and we thought could have been  seasoned a bit.  Red cabbage was very delicious.   The rib eye steaks were tender and cooked to our liking.   The mushroom soup was tasty.   The pretzel rolls that came with our meal  were good and served with butter and mustard  We would definitely come back another time and try other menu choices.   We are not beer drinkers.  However,  this restaurant features a variety of German as well as other beers. This restaurant also  offers a Sunday Brunch and a beer club for lunch and dinner on Tuesdays

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Rib eye steak
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Sauerbraten
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Pretzel rolls

BDqQsVek91dm9wgXa5Jd7g.text: First, allow me to say that I can definitely see the appeal of this place if you are enamored with German cuisine.  The ambiance has it's charms.  The service was on point, our waiter was very helpful and attentive.  Having an accordion player on staff was a very nice touch.  The food was prepared well, and as German food goes, I won't complain.  However, there was a roach on the windowsill. Also our kartoffelpuffer was served somehow with a gnat or a flea.  For me, this ruined the whole experience.  I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Gnat or flea on side plate. It wasn&#39;t there before the kartoffelpuffer was placed from it&#39;s serving dish into the side plate.
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Roach on windowsill.

8W83uQY7CWIP9F7Nin4HKg.text: Oh. My.  Goodness.  Loved this place! The hubs and I got goulash to share as an appetizer and I could not recommend it more!  It went very well with the complimentary pretzels rolls which were also to die for.  We went on a Saturday evening so there was a very friendly accordion player walking around, really enjoyed it.  I had the schnitzel with gravy and extra spaetzle.  The spaetzle was perfect, I was disappointed with the schnitzel though.  I normally have mine plain with lemon but there was no flavoring on the breading and it was very plain.  Once I had it with the gravy it was very good though!  My husband got the sampler and loved every bit of it!  Very happy customers

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Pretzel roll
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Waldhorn Sampler

lyTubKCdbBV5s4WJOE6riA.text: Came here for my wife's company bash. Great selection of German Cuisine and Beers. Since I've never had this before I had the lemon chicken and it was delicious.

eHVcKV3b4mxeaFWqBB0J6A.text: Nice family owned restaurant. They have a great Sunday brunch buffet with German Classics as well as American favorites and an omelette bar. Great atmosphere! In the fall, they do Oktoberfest from late September through the end of October.

U34_XaZ28voXToHKf6wVow.text: I was very excited to finally try Waldhorn and enjoyed walking up to the place as much as walking in the door to a German chateau. I did try the jagerschnitzel with spatzles and loved the schnitzel and sauce. With red cabbage as a side. I loved the red cabbage- so delicious. I have to say the spatzles were disappointing to me, since I love them so much I make them. These didn't have the right density, they were a little too fluffy for my taste. Overall though great experience, ambiance and the food was authentic, unique for here and I'd love to try some other menu items in the future.

gxe4kP65Oorh54d41L1Adg.text: Beer, Schnitzel and a little old man in lederhosen playing the accordion is enough for the 5 stars but there's more!  Service was great and they have a decent selection of authentic German fare.

6CCLTPKl5hmm2KR3za-13A.text: This was easily the best since living in Germany; took me back to the Kaisertisch Marnheim, where the staff naturally interacted with guests, laughed loudly, and played music. There was no sense of anyone just going through the motions. I'm curious about the fries. While driving to Sembach Airbase, we used to stop on the side of the road to buy the BEST pommes frites from a street vendor. Ah, memories... Can't wait to dive deeper into the menu. Excellent experience all around!

kO_JQzpotcSOnhv19HTbNQ.text: If you are like me, you dont know much about German food. My aunt who was born n raised in Germany loves this place. So they must be making the food right. But personally, the three times I have eaten here, I havent been impressed. And the service, even my aunt will agree, is very lacking. Sometimes you get an experienced, on her game server. And then you are treated right. But twice we have gotten an inexperienced, confused and unskilled server. And That was no fun. The brunch buffet has plenty to offer and the american dishes and sides are good food. Find yourself a good server and you will enjoy your brunch.

oqogKvIgr8Tl319Hh-MYxQ.text: I went here for oktoberfest, so I didnt expect anything to necessarily be top notch, as its got to be their busiest time of the year. But this was like a live action train wreck.  Got an appetizer before beers, which then flew off the plate onto the table, and then taken away hastily. We waved down the food runner to alert her it was ours, and she graced us with a fun anecdote concerning her co workers ability to count. We asked about beers again. They arrived and it was clear that the head of the beer was gone and so was its ideal temperature. Once again, it was packed, i get it, there is a lot going on and the guys only human. So we order food. Everyone has beers in hand now, so all is calm. Food comes out at a reasonable time. Our dish stated it had mushrooms and came with a vegetable of the day. It had neither, except for one single mushroom that was like a needle in the haystack. Whatever the opposite of visually stunning is, is how I would describe our dish. But whatever, life goes on. We all have another beer and basically just chalk it up as a loss given all the circumstances. Then the unthinkable occurred. We had stacked all our dishes to be helpful for the server. With his foot propping open the door he asked me to hand them to him. Feeling as though I was on candid camera, i picked up the stack, got out of my chair and handed them to him. As things wrapped up, and to our astonishment- the checks were separated accurately. So that was nice. I realize its unfair to judge solely during this event, but it sure was unforgettable.

_KUivWG6vE6AgIJYx9yDVQ.text: Good German food. We wanted to try some new place to eat and gave this place a try it was definitely different and great tasting would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

pesY_Poo1JPMMQh4tl1erw.text: German food is something I'm not familiar with, but nonetheless, I was excited to try a local restaurant while here on business. The staff was exceedingly kind. Our waiter answered all of our questions and explained variations in menu items well. Once we ordered, our food came relatively quickly and was presented beautifully. While the food was great, the service went downhill at this point. Our waiter was not seen for the rest of the evening. I waved down a staff member when I needed more water. We waved down another waiter when we wanted to order dessert. We waved down yet another person when we were ready for our check. Had the standards of service remained as they had began, this review would certainly be better.

-61wC8BmcEN9DFgvr5rFhg.text: Came for a quick dinner and ended up staying for 2 hours! Loved the food, delicious beer, great atmosphere, even better staff!! Would recommend 110% Definitely a new favorite.

doSOHqZcYWKtrjdN4GwQgg.text: This place is great!  It is the only German restaurant in the area that I know of.  The food is delicious and they have buffets on different night, and a weekend brunch.  I would recommend trying the buffet, but also going at a time they don't have it, so you can sample from the menu.  They serve your meal with pretzel rolls and they are to die for!!!  They always come out fresh and warm.  The restaurant is huge!  They have different events there from time to time.  I have been to the beer fest in the fall, and it was really fun.  They have a large selection of beers to choose from.  The staff is friendly and welcoming.  This is a great place to try for dinner with friends and family.

3C1SCwAZSYdbLtGh5XovUA.text: I absolutely love this restaurant. The atmosphere is nice and the food is great. Everything I have tried from the menu has been delicious. They even have Oktoberfest every year which is a blast.

lsrbpH7q45OdFNqEdBiARA.text: Really good authentic German food and beer. The hostess had a weird vibe and stood at the station just staring at us for the 10 min we had to wait for a noon lunch booth. Whatever. The food came and it was delicious, although the waiter never came back by to check on us before the check, it wasn't necessarily needed because the food was on point. Would definitely go back for lunch if in the area. Note: it's not the fastest lunch if you're on a time crunch.

9EERaurL9ZyqgznbqLDV9g.text: Very good authentic german food. A welcome ethnic treat for any occasion. Very large beer and spirits menu too. The service is always great when we have went and food always wonderful.

tawbAZ5r0a-NyO0smsGAgQ.text: We made the (long) drive to Waldhorn's for Oktoberfest as advertised on facebook. Unfortunately we misunderstood the post or it wasn't clear that the festivities don't begin until 5pm. So we had lunch; Weinerschnitzel with spaetzel and red cabbage (with cinnamon & brown sugar?) was great!  Also the specialty combo-salad plate which was just ok. They offer a great beer flight of four 4 oz glasses. We had to have dessert; the apple strudel and chocolate mousse- both excellent (not too sweet) and beautifully presented.  Wesley Z. is an excellent server, German and somewhat old school, very informative and polite; a bonus to have him!  We'll be back!

79vT0jPtovqkBc0fO5ffIA.text: I have been to the Oktoberfest parties here in the past, which are fun also but always neglected actually coming for a sit down meal. I was pleasantly surprised by how delicious the food is here. I was skeptical about it to be honest, but I was happily proven wrong. The Jagerschnitzel and apple strudel were both presented well and equally delicious. I'm sorry I didn't try this place out sooner.

G7_gmTBAbx9lI5hSBe1aIg.text: Food is below mediocre. Ambiance of an old diner. Beer selection is probably the only thing that is good there. Trust us, we are German, this is not good or authentic German food.

sC00aXkZJzlB7-NToRAHpw.text: Always knew of this place, but never had a desire to go......but yesterday, our neighbors who love it, got us to go.......and very glad we did!.....we had a 5:30 reservation, and were sat immediately, and it was already packed.....for appetizer we had the potato pancakes and they were great!....i had the filet wrapped in bacon and puff pastry...kind of a high end Wellington...it was " market price"...which ended up being $27.95, but....absolutely the best piece of steak i ever had....everything on my plate was amazing....wife had the veggie mix in puff pastry...also great flavors, ton of food......others had versions of schnitzel...and all loved them....finished off with a " on the house" piece of black forest cake, which was super moist and full of flavor....very enjoyable meal, fair prices and great service.....we will return for sure.

G-txF8xMqubPbYkNb4zvsQ.text: The beer is amazing.  If you come, get one of their drafts and you won't be disappointed. I got the sampler plate.  I really liked the bratwurst and the pork schnitzel but the rouladin was very dry... so dry we asked for more gravy... which we also used on the schnitzels because they didn't have much either. My boyfriend got the veal schnitzel and it was my favorite.  It was a bit weird getting it with fries though.  I wish they had an option with the red cabbage and spaetzle instead.  We were celebrating his birthday and they gave us a free piece of black forest cake.  It tasted like they went a grocery store to get it, but it was free so no complaint

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

VhRmQETzkWFtOzyWY4yvww.text: The waitress was very pleasant and prompt, if not for her I'd rate it minus one star.  In chronological order  1- The restaurant was overdue for refreshing ten years ago - see photo 2- Noisy, scratchy sounding music the loud acoustics are real unpleasant 3 -Lager and Pilsner beers only: not one single imported Ale available, not even an amber beer 4- The kitchen was very very slow  5- The food wasn't any good: the sausages were burned, the schnitzel was like rubber etc etc, really nothing good to say about any of it.   Not that any of this matters, all the other tables seemed happy and having a good time, apparently Waldhorn has found its clientele, it just doesn't include us.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Dining room vents.

wbohlV37z2pBVrkJDsEfWw.text: I love this place.   If you fancy German food- sausages, Snitzel, red cabbage, spaetzle, and good beer, then check it out.

WDgGuAbaS3HEkB8Lc0w_Yg.text: All around experience was good! We went on a Friday and they had a musician going around asking for suggestions. The food was good! I got the duck with dumplings. It was good, not great. I really like a good juicy and tender duck. But it was a little too done. The German draft beer is always good, but I feel like they had pretty basic beers to choose from. Our waiter was great as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

cs6I7_dDVnd6p_PASWkrMg.text: Good food not exactly what I'd call a sandwich with one slice of bread.  Yet tasty. I will return again.

DTzf5qLV4SFXk4fs0eH6iw.text: Always a great meal coupled with good service.   The outside look of a castle on the Rhine sets the atmosphere for the entire meal.  Excellent beef roulade,  and the spaetzle is light as a cloud.  You can never fo wrong with Waldhorn's.

36-BBMGNoKqtAKsNhFgbug.text: The other night, we wanted to try something different for dinner. I've had this place bookmarked for awhile and my fiance was excited to try it. Here is what you need to know about me: my family is Czech and I've been all over Europe, including Germany so I had high expectations.   We got there and were told the wait would be 35 minutes. It ended up being an hour. Not the end of the world but I wish we had been given a more accurate estimate. We each got a beer and liked them. We started with the potato pancakes and they were aaaaaaaamazing! So flavorful and delicious. For our meals, my fiance got the Schweizer Schnitzel with Spatzle and mashed potatoes. He loved his meal and had no complaints. I got the sampler with Spatzle and bread dumplings. I loved the schnitzel and the brat but the steak was soooooooooooooo (insert a million "o"s here) dry. I pretty much left the entire thing on my plate and my fiance didn't even eat it (which says a lot because he loves meat). For dessert we shared the apfelstrudel and it was divine.   Our server was great and seemed to know the menu really well. Overall, I thought this was a solid experience and we will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Waldhorn Sampler
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Schweizer Schnitzel

YIU8Vy6IV6Er1EoXF8b8iA.text: Authentic German food! I had a legit hamburger:) my husband had a bratwurst sandwich. We loved both and the beer on tap is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

BvSv2bg4zEE8yGGyLDHL7w.text: Having not really experienced German food, I was looking forward to checking out Waldhorn with my dinner group.  We had reservations at 7:00pm for 6 people.  We were able to get seated without the whole group which was nice.  The restaurant outside looks like a German castle, and inside is huge, but could definitely use some upgrading. Tables and chairs are older and minimal decor.  After ordering some "beers" we received some pretzel rolls and placed an order for the Sausage Appetizer. The pretzel rolls were so good, and don't forget to use the mustard!! The appetizer was a sample of three sausages over a brown gravy sauce.   We all ordered different menu options, but the majority of the table ordered pork, as they have several pork options. Everyone seemed to enjoy their meals very much.  The sauerkraut seemed to be a hit over the spaetzel.  I ordered the Prime Rib, the Thursday night special.  I was a little underwhelmed, should have stuck with a German dish. Most of ordered dessert to go, I chose the cheesecake. I will say the cheesecake was some of the best I have ever had. Overall, I am glad I was able to check out Waldhorn.  Not sure I would run back, but know if I am ever craving German food or beer this is the spot to come.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Pork with Sauerkraut and Cabbage
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Pork Schnitzel
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Prime Rib, Thursday night Special!

ShMVpKN8s9V_kIHHs3QGFQ.text: Sunday buffet is always delicious. They only do reservation for 6 or more. You may have to wait but worth it.

jvF_s4wQuvpC6ooGn2EAJg.text: As German restaurants go, this place was above average. I chose to go with the Jaegerschnitzel with sides of red cabbage, spaetzle and potato salad. I really liked the Hunter gravy that was served over the schnitzel. It had a hint of wine and had some chunks of tasty mushrooms within. My only complaint was with the potato salad. I was expecting it to be like typical German potato salad made with vinegar and bacon- there was none of either in it and had an overall lack of flavor.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. View of the bar area!

YwFgYmD5cBtgFH0_ux7HAg.text: I want to love this place. My partner is German. I really like the beer options but the food just isn't that great

75NKmPrzCPas71jHBOn1tA.text: The food might be awesome- I don't know we didn't get a chance to try. Because they messed up our reservations and refused to sit us down... we called ahead and you advised us within 15 min we could get a table. In order to make it happen, me and my husband have to drive two cars since I was out with my baby. We made it within 10 min and they didn't put us in a call ahead list nor reservation. And told us oops- there is 30 min more to wait. It's ok to wait if you inform us ahead so we could better plan on our end but not rush and wasted two trips with a 10month old baby. no matter how good the food is if you don't RESPECT your customer and rejected them to come in because of your fault. It's the worst. I really hope the owner cares since the front desk on average take 10 min to sit one table and couldn't keep up. Well- I'm the end if you make your customer feel rejected and no REPECT You won't last long.... bye forever. The worst experience we had in Charlotte since we moved here.

j9H-5sTr34O55ozzYaGrSA.text: Came here for Oktoberfest for the second time Saturday night and it is now something I plan to do every year. What to expect? Well, first of all as you pull up you can tell by the building you are in for some great authentic German cuisine. This place is definitely worth the drive from Charlotte.   Typically we will dine in the restaurant before going out to the tent and enjoy a 1L beer along with our entrees.  Expect a crowd during Oktoberfest of course but we didn't have to wait all that long.  They also have a food menu for outside if you want to go straight to the festivities.  Upon setting down my first recommendation is to enjoy the pretzel roll!!! I repeat- a yummy pretzel roll is a must.  Don't forget the mustard. The beer selection is great and they always have a good selection from Lagers to Dark Hofbrau. I certainly have to get a Marzen Oktoberfest  beer for the occasion.   I typically order the "Weinershnitzel"  with the spatzle.  This version is with pork and not veal but still amazing.  They even brought me a side of the jager gravy.  Delicious!  The spatzle is also really good.  So good that I could eat a plate of it myself.  If you want to try several things go for the sampler.  A little pricey but a good way to try the schnitzel and a brat.    The server will give you a wristband so you can get in the tent outside for free if you dine inside.  By the way the service is always good here.  Outside is always fun and this year really enjoyed the band. The bands name is Prost in case you are wondering.  Worth checking out for sure.  Until next time.....  Prost!

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

4i5sjTikO-f_u6ju7eQg5g.text: Called ahead as told and was told upon arrival they could sit us at a table that we would have to vacate for an 8 pm reservation. That would give us 1.5 hours. With a large portion of your menu cooked to order, that's not feasible especially since I shouldn't be rushed as a paying customer. I waited tables for ten years and never once presented that to patrons as a waitress or a hostess. Doubt I'll be back.

zS17-mbri61UAgDR4lQQAw.text: We don't come here enough! Oktoberfest for sure but also fun for a change of pace dinner and to remind us of our Germany trip.   Love the schnitzel. Can't beat the German beer selections. The accordion player is always fun.

aIOUNlOMlSY1zN77LViGMg.text: It's always a great time at Waldhorn. We always start out with the delicious pretzel bread with spicy mustard. It's my fave place to drink beer in town as they have a wonderfully delicious selection. My first choice is the Spaten Optimator but I may choose the Schofferhofer depending on my meal. I'd say my favorite meal would be the sampler as it has some of the best on the menu on one plate but you can't go wrong whatever you decide to go with. I would also recommend ordering extra sauce if your choice comes with it as the sauces are amazing. You've got to try Waldhorn for your next special occasion. You won't regret it.

sLpstZjWKNHLuE2PCYc5KQ.text: I really enjoyed this different take on food! The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is the buffet is only available on Sundays and it was awesome! It can't ever be as good only having one item from the menu! GREAT food!!!!!!

kgrI69Z6TzqZDGts2t2upw.text: Now I really try to like this place , especially since my fiance lived in Germany for a few years and when I took him here with friends for his birthday he proposed to me . So of course it is special to me for other reasons. However this site is to help review the food and to be honest I just think it's bland and incredibly boring.. The only items I care for are the red cabbage and the dumplings other than that I have tried several different things because my fiance gets in the mood for German food and this is the only place in Charlotte we know of .. Other than for sentimental reasons though I personally would not chose to eat here.

RTdvVeLNevhBMpIDmaPs8g.text: We went to Waldhorns for the first time recently. The place is gorgeous from the outside but once you step in its a huge disappointment. It's dated, worn and looks a little dirty (the Vents on the wall near the bathroom are DISGUSTING) what really ruined the trip for me was their seating "policy" we had a reservation for 5pm When we entered (at 4:48) there were a few people standing in the very small entry way. We checked in with the hostess  And she said we would be seated at 5pm But wanted us to be "aware that our table has a 6:30 reservation" I asked if she could go ahead and seat us (there were LOTS of empty tables) since we'd never been there and may take some time reviewing the menu before we order. She said that they don't seat until the exact time of the reservation to avoid "overwhelming the kitchen"!! So several of us stood there..including a woman with a walker..while the tables sat empty so the kitchen wouldn't be overwhelmed!!! That is the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard. When you seat 10 tables at once chances are those 10 orders are going in at the same time!! How does leaving tables empty and customers standing in the cramped foyer make any sense to anyone?! After a couple more minutes I asked her again...its 5 o'clock can we be seated now? She replied "it's 4:58 but I guess we could go ahead and seat you" Seriously??!!!   With the exception of the Pretzel rolls which were fabulous and terrific service from our waitress Renee Everything else was a huge disappointment. Will definitely not go back.

adxYrWAII_Th5IVC_Mpn9w.text: I took an out-of-town guest here for dinner.  Our hopes were up as we walked up to the building and then entered.  The restaurant was busy with two private parties; however, we were seated upon arrival, and there was still plenty of seating available.  First off, the beer menu.  They have a fairly decent selection of drafts and bottles--think an extended list of your usual German suspects (Spaten, Franziskaner, Warsteiner, etc.).  Ultimately, I wasn't very impressed.  The bill of fare had a decent amount of variety, and the descriptions made narrowing a selection difficult.  Fortunately, the sampler special of the evening provided a convenient choice!  I started with the bowl of Hungarian Goulash.  The portion was quite large.  However, I found the broth somewhat too salty, and the meat chunks were dry and tough.  Like the soup, I found my entree to be a little too salty, which was disappointing, because the spaetzle and red cabbage were otherwise quite nice.  I found the meats to be somewhat dry and tough, similar to that of the goulash.  All of this was too bad, because the portions were easily large enough for two meals.  Finally, I'm guessing "dry" must be a theme at this place, because even the black forest cake was also a little dry.  For the record:  I didn't complain nor send any of the food back out of respect for my guest.  I just didn't want to create a scene in front of my guest.  Waitstaff were prompt enough, but our server kept forgetting drink orders and generally just seemed nonchalant about providing good service.  So, minus one star for the ditzy waitress.  Minus 1.5 stars for the food.  I rounded down, because I disagree with the more positive reviews.  I was expecting something stellar, and I feel rather let down.  I will come back and give them one more chance, but only one more chance.

NceSGMS4jYaqkOEFgNZduA.text: An all around great restaurant!  The service is friendly and fast and the food does not disappoint.  The sausage plate and goat cheese appetizers are both fantastic as well as the complimentary pretzel rolls.  They have plenty of traditional German fare such as Weinerschnitzel, sauerkraut, spaetzle, etc. and it is all delicious!  Beware: the portions are HUGE.  Luckily, they offer a "Lite Appetite" menu as well. If you save room for dessert, the apple strudel is a must. It's great to have this restaurant in Charlotte, it's very unique and stands out.

FwvlgmZREYOTigODbjEiOg.text: I'm giving this 3 stars ONLY because I really liked the beer selection.   I laughed at the review about the CIA lighting until I was there being interrogated myself. Why is it so bright? I would venture to say that actually ruined our experience. I was expecting a really inviting and warm atmosphere, not a huge, lit-up cafeteria-like dining hall. The outside looks so intriguing, but that all goes away when you go inside!   The food we had was pretty good. I had the Schweizer Schnitzel which I will equate to Chicken Cordon Bleu with Pork. It was tasty, but didn't knock my socks off. My husband had Rindsrouladen (beef roll with onions, pickles in a gravy) - this was intriguing more than anything. We found the food to be pretty good, but maybe we're just not that into German food?   The best things about this place were: 1. the pretzel rolls, these are worth going back in themselves, so delicious! 2. the beer! You can't beat 4.25 for the selection they have. I really liked the dark wheat beer on draft and it's not something you see anywhere else.   Not sure if we'll be back...unless it's for the pretzel rolls!

NdzYieH_oEr3M5jfOt5WVA.text: Food was average. German beer was good. Friendly staff, an overall good experience. Nothing special but nothing bad. Definitely a good place to get some German food.

iRt2Hjcw1eoPgln-blZKQw.text: Absolutely fantastic authentic German cuisine. Went for the first time for restaurant week and the portions were beyond huge. Great entertainment as well on Saturday nights by buffalo bill the  accordion player. Can't wait to go back for Sunday brunch.

wLbJW88n5dEKjYVTeJd89A.text: Went with a large group. Fast service, great service! The pretzel rolls are delish! I ordered the house side salad and the lighter appetite marinated beef slices. It was a delicious, German meal. Would highly recommend if UR a German or if you love German dishes

aleiHE7pTsJVbCyWf_31YA.text: First time here this past Friday for lunch. Hadn't had a Wiener schnitzel since Vienna. I really enjoyed Waldhorn 's version. I will be back.

CDrqMyFmDIb4GIBQmgaABA.text: I had Munich Spaten Oktoberfest beer with carpaccio beef and salad vinaigrette for an appetizer. Venison rouladen with hunter sauce, red cabbage, spatzle, poached pear and lingon berry sauce for dinner.   I had no room for dessert, although I'm sure it would have been great if I did.   The accordian player was great, and came over to play us "Que Sera Sera" and we all sang along!  A great time was had by all.

k-7Bu2KW4fPnLWowEOxkrA.text: Awesome!! If you love Germany you have to try it. We enjoyed the sausage platter, and two entrees and we loved it. The beer is ice cold and awesome. Don't pass this place up.

iJ1kY7w55I979N2AyO2zkQ.text: This is one of those places I really want to LOVE for some reason!  So I was glad to go back for lunch today and get the items I liked last time and taste something new.  The service was very good last time, today it was even better.  My choice today was the "International Hoagie" This was very Good an easy 4 yelp stars of: Roast Beef, Westphalian Ham, Salami, Turkey, Fleischkaese, Swiss Cheese, Lettuce and Tomato on a fantastic Pretzel Hoagie Roll.  This usually is served with Tarragon-Balsamic Mayonnaise, which I asked them to leave off.  The only other change I asked was to add onions.  This sandwich was very good!  French Fries were offered with this sandwich though I substituted the delicious "Home Fries" cooked with bits of Bacon...5 yelp stars Yum!  For Dessert I had "Schokoladenmus" Chocolate Mousse served with Bourbon Sauce and Fresh Fruit, it was A-OK 3 yelp stars.  The next course was five Pretzel Rolls looking great on a plate (see photos of all this if you like).  The next course, was a course of action to pay and get out before i ordered more food!  Oktoberfest here starts Friday September 23 and is for the weekends only (four weekends Fridays and Saturdays).  Next time I'll be there for dinner and eat outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Pretzel rolls
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. &#34;Schokoladenmus&#34;  Chocolate Mousse with Bourbon Sauce and fresh Fruit

Kb_mcc63p_Uex8cG3lInnQ.text: Wunderbar! Authentic! Eleven German draft beers. The server( Stefanie) was from Dresden and did a great job. Sauerbraten, spatzle, and rot kohl were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Buffet

n47ylW9GtmuOzy7u9_NBLQ.text: Because every town needs a good German restaurant, just wish it wasn't so out of the way. Beer club member here and there is also a meetup group that holds an awesome board game night here on a regular basis.

Bcd72D7spda1Lq5uQbhtpQ.text: Good German food done at home is hard to do and time consuming IF you are not a native accustomed to the techniques required for more complex recipes like sauerbraten and rindsrouladen. How fortunate we are to have Waldhorn in Pineville (Charlotte)!  I love sauerbraten and Waldhorn's chef does it right. However... MORE SPECIAL is Waldhorn's rindsrouladen... it is NOT a taste that is EASY to prepare with a well-balanced blending of flavors. It is difficult enough that most restaurants fall far short of serving outstandingly delicious rouladen! Most of the time I would never order this at a German restaurant as my ONLY entree selection without a personal endorsement I trusted. The first time at Waldhorn was NO different... except it was included in the Waldhorn sampler selection the first time I tried it. WOW!!!  I was enjoying a draft Spaten Dark, red cabbage, spatzle, and sampler servings of 3 entrees... a sausage that was very tasty, a piece of jagerschnitzel, and the rouladen which I will order again as my entree next time I go to Waldhorn. Everyone does not have a taste for this entree and some would not even want to "acquire" a taste for it. I understand... but I also spent my college days in a town that had 3 excellent German restaurants and a huge German ethnic populace. I spent a lot of time dining in these establishments.  For those who appreciate German beers, Waldhorn is sure to have several selections that will please... a dozen on draft and over two dozen bottled choices. ALL of them are served VERY COLD in FROSTY MUGS. Goes so well with the complimentary pretzel rolls served... and you can get SECONDS, but they'll charge for the beer!  An interesting highlight to the meal at Waldhorn was OUR SERVER for the evening... she had been very pleasant and attentive to our requests & questions. Later during our meal I mentioned HOW SPECIAL I thought the rouladen was & she was very candid. She had been born in Germany & was in Charlotte going to college. She volunteered that she was not especially fond of rouladen made by anyone other than her mom, BUT she added that Waldhorn did rouladen as good or maybe better than her mom! She loves the rouladen at Waldhorn! Now THAT is what I would classify as a "credible personal endorsement."  As for decor and ambiance... authentic architecture, many in authentic dress, authentic live music, festive German geniality. A nice slice of Germany in Pineville. Well worth a visit. The Sunday brunch buffet is great value for what is offered at the brunch buffet price. BE SURE to check out the many desserts... EACH a temptation making it hard ONLY TO CHOOSE the wife-limited number!  The crowded parking lot CONFIRMS that most patrons like Waldhorn and are repeat guests! You MAY park on the grass... or get creative if the grass is already claimed.

VSO1sqHwL9pXJHjrzuetjQ.text: Best German food in town. A good traditional beer selection along with traditional favorites such as wurst and schnitzel. Their Oktoberfest tent is a blast and worth a visit. If you can't make it across the pond then the Waldhorn  is a trip worth making.

G7H7kZuoepeO_lbcLCZEVQ.text: While I do revel in trendy, upscale, "nouvelle cuisine" type places, (and no, I did not just make that up...) I have to give credit where credit is due.  "We're going to Waldhorn for dinner."  "A Wal what??"--my reply.  Waldhorn is a German restaurant in the Matthews area.  It's not easy to drag me away from my comfort zip codes, but this turned out to be a treat.    No frills here.  As other reviewers have noted, the "investigation lighting" was off putting.  If I have peppercorns in my teeth, I would rather find out about it after my meal.  Our waitress was super friendly and gladly dimmed the lights for us.  Nice, friendly staff!   We started with the bratwurst sausage appetizer plate and the "Gebackenber Ziegenkase," which is goat cheese, spinach and sundried tomatoes stuffed in a phyllo dough pastry.  The sausage came with sauerkraut (I am a fan) and a spicy mustard.  I favored the smoked wurst and ate the spicy mustard until my sinuses were clear.  No Day Quil required!  For my entree, I wanted something straight up German.  I opted for the Sauerbraten.  This is a braised marinated beef dish served with spatzle and red cabbage.  I had never had spatzle, but it is a fettucini-esque noodle with more texture.  I loved the texture of these noodles.  The beef and gravy that it came with were delicious.  Tender and bursting with flavor.    Ooh, and the beer I ordered (a wheat beer whose name I can't remember) came in a tall cylindrical glass that made me feel like something special!  The meal was hearty and delicious. Lots of male customers.  I wouldn't typically crave or think about this type of food, but for what it was, it was an enjoyable experience!

LL8Bsco3jhC4P-rX_Okzdw.text: Went there for lunch not overly crowded but there was no hostess,  after about 5 minutes a waitress came and seated us.    Had the bratwurst sandwich on a pretzel hoagie with fries.  It was ok nothing special.  Our waitress was slow and never came to give is refills.   I'd  give it another try   But it was just ok.  I could get the same sandwich at Jason's deli

9PgPyAGn5KQpaIaproUD9g.text: You don't have to wear lederhosen to come to Waldhorn, but my theory has always been that it never hurts to wear lederhosen.  Wearing a fun outfit is just good times right off the bat.    I've eaten at Walhorn 8 or 10 times over the last couple years and love everything about Gitta's restaurant.  All of the food is excellent and I especially like the $5.50 "buffet" that is available to Waldhorn Beer Club members on Tuesday nights.  I won't outline any particular meal for you because I've tried quite a few of them and have been disappointed by none. And the pretzel rolls are fantastic!  It's the best pretzel bread you've ever wrapped your lips around. They have a wonderful German beer selection and you are given the ability to choose your drink size up to a full liter.  I wish half pints would catch on at more bars Stateside.    Brian, the restaurant manager, is quite gregarious and will leave you with a smile on your face should you happen to meet him.  After a couple visits to Waldhorn you kinda feel like you're family.

c2dogT13v8P9-NwxWZlRWw.text: The food was of fine dining quality, delicious, and the perfect quantity.  Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the food preparation and beverages.  We cannot wait to return with our family.  The atmosphere is relaxing and on Saturday night there is a roaming musician playing and chatting with the guest.  Really enjoyed it.

M8pXGlbr2KGPYI98O1niPg.text: After many trips to Germany I can honestly say this is the best German food I've had on the east coast of the states. A lot of German standards, good beer and spaetzle. I do wish they had pig knuckles though.

uCawBdbRg64iMZ66G9I4hA.text: Wow what a great surprise, I have drive past this place hundreds of times. So finally I tried it and it's great! Everything we had was good from the appetite to the entrees. Large portions and great tasting food.

U0bb-0CNTqvV9LxYdEkAqg.text: Ate here last night. I had the pork tenderloin with caper cognac sauce and potato croquettes !!! Very very good !!! We will be back :)

Vv-qLdpaMNrpG8l6fX3-tg.text: Came here the other day and had THE. BEST. SERVICE. EVER. Everything was spot on- drinks, apps, entrees, you name it. Even swamped with the Oktoberfest, I was blown away. Tipped 30%. Food was fantastic as usual. Try this place out!

2QehtIUfbl3ZRmiTemb2Mg.text: We've enjoyed the waldhorn for years. It is consistently fantastic. Everything is homemade and it shows. Some people have talked about the decor. It is outdated by a consumerist American standard but it is supposed to look German. This is what restraints in Germany look like. No need to update, it's authentic. Everything on the menu is awesome. The chef makes fantastic soups. Always ask for a sample of the soup of the day. Great beer selection. This is one of our main stays.

bf14IZcxLzwWLFNuTuYA_w.text: We have lived in Charlotte for almost 4 years and always wanted to go to this place, but were put off because they only take reservations for parties of 6 or more. Last night, the two of us decided to walk in early (about 6:00 P.M. on a Friday night, our date night) and were immediately seated. We were put in a back room containing two large, long tables and a few tables for four. One of the large tables was already filled with about 20 people, and the noise was deafening.
