That entire room apparently has nothing on the walls or ceiling to absorb noise. We noticed that, at one of the tables for four, people were getting up and leaving without ordering. Even worse, the place has a lot of young children who were constantly running around and getting in the way of the waitstaff which, by the way, was excellent.  We started with two Ketel One on the rocks. When ordering a second round, we were told they had run out of Ketel One--at 6:15 on a Friday night. We then split a Waldhorn salad, which was good. We both had the sauerbraten with spaeztle and red cabbage. The meat was dry and the spaetzle didn't even look or taste like spaetzle. From our experience, spaetzle are dumplings pressed through a sieve.. This stuff looked and tasted more like doughy noodles. Since I love Black Forest cake, I took a piece home. It was tasteless, and the fruit center was nothing more than filler. This was represented to us as "home made."  The owners of this place are represented as having been culinary-institute trained. We can't believe it. We have eaten at restaurants owned and operated by culinary-institute graduates and the food tasted nothing like this. We cannot, therefore, understand the rave reviews. We also cannot understand how culinary-institute graduates (if this is actually so) could serve this stuff. To each his own, I guess.

JCuTpCgK9FdNej5Mxj8Avg.text: THIS REVIEW IS FOR THEIR BRUNCH. IF IT IS SUNDAY BEFORE 230PM AND YOU ARE READING THIS - STOP. GO TO THE WALHORN. THEN RETURN TO SAID YELP REVIEW AND THANK ME. THIS IS NOT A JOKE. THIS IS VERY REAL.  Sometimes there are things in life that you just can't express in words full how much such and such means to you. Or how much you hate it. Or love it. This is ALMOST one of those cases, but for you fine people I will spit some lyrical truth about this epic brunch.  Best roast beef in the land Sliced by hand, On your Command, Delish.  Breakfast foods ye seek, Might as well get 2 plates, French toast and hashbrowns peak, Under all that bacon.  Sausages are varied, Mustard with them - heaven. Sauerbraten, sauerkraut, spaitzel Oh look, schnitzel - I'll have 7  I love you Waldhorn Brunch. I want to spend my life with you. This isn't a poem. BRB going for another trip (and don't skip dessert!)

2xkAiiVbmyP_MM81pZAqSA.text: Not our first visit and not our last. Great quality German food and beers. Spatzle red cabbage and schnitzels galore. I like the wurst platte and the wife loves Jagerschnitzel. Portions are not quite big enough to split unless you load up on soups and the fabulous pretzel bread.

ZeSNXO-xWJHv60jQoaZ0aA.text: I would go back again.  Went with my roommate, we were seated for lunch time on a Saturday afternoon quickly.  Nearby the Red Hat Women's Society were gathering for lunch and we had the chance to see some really nice hats!  The menu is in both German & English and if you have any questions, your server will explain the ingredients or how it's made.  Our server was Val, who was very informative and friendly.  I'm glad I asked what made German potato salad different than American potato salad because it's served cold and made with beef broth.. I'm a vegetarian, so if i'd have ordered it, I would have either not been able to enjoy it or send it back to the kitchen.  Always best making informed decisions.  My roommate also had question about what was in the pasta pillows, which is a mixture of pork, beef, turkey and spinach.. and since she doesn't eat pork, it's very good she asked and didn't order blindly.  For appetizers she ordered the potato pancakes with applesauce, and I ordered the pumpkin soup... both were delicious!  I've had the potato pancakes before and they were exactly as I remembered, crispy on the outside and tenderly cooked potato pieces on the inside and with the combination of the cool applesauce.. very good.  The pumpkin soup was delicious!  I mean absolutely heavenly.. it was like I was eating a thick warm soupy pumpkin pie complete with a dabble of cream.  Nice pieces of pumpkin throughout.  Pumpkin soup is a fall treat and favorite!  On to the entrees: I ordered the Portobello Mushroom Sandwich which was also very tasty and filling.  The sandwich is served on rye and is filled with of course portobello mushroom, munster cheese, spinach, and a very delightful tomato aioli pesto spread, and a pickle on the side.  The sandwich comes with a side.  The choices are German potato salad, mixed greens, mixed vegetables or french fries.  I opted for the decent sized salad of mixed greens, carrots, cabbage and balsamic vinaigrette.  My roommate got the fried flounder with a large salad (German potato salad, mixed greens, carrot salad, etc. all mixed together).  She seemed to enjoy it.  Didn't have time for dessert as I had to dash to work, but overall it was a good experience.  The restaurant is very beautiful on the outside, clean and organized on the inside, family-oriented, staff is helpful and attentive, prices are reasonable.  They even offer classes to learn German which I thought was pretty neat, and there is live music on both Friday and Saturday evenings.  The restaurant is fairly active in the community by participating in and holding community events, such as Oktoberfest and holiday gatherings throughout the year.

jPN9JFzaYVvKxvuyNNP5pg.text: Wow!  Talk about comfort food!  Potato pancakes and Chicken Nadia with a large Optimater were my choices. Had to take home a slice of the Black Forest, too. Probably sleep like a rock tonight. Atmosphere is nice and the service is perfect. I'll definitely be back!

1H2X1hBCZ_dVXVnNulA4Mg.text: OUTSTANDING experience at Waldhorn this evening.  We started out with the sausage and sauerkraut appetizer with 3 kinds of sausage - very good.  The pretzel rolls were very tasty too.  I had the roasted duck with bread dumplings and red cabbage - great.  We ended our terrific food experiences with an apple strudel and a piece of black forest cake - wow    Service was great.

GavljKr-0JzIOBEk4ANrjg.text: My family went here for Easter lunch- party of 15 & we had the whole upstairs basically to ourselves. The waiter was fantastic!! Officiant, courteous, professional & friendly. It was a buffet & everything was hot, fresh & delicious. They worked hard at keeping all the choices full. The only thing that didn't sit well was their rating of a 91. That's pretty low. We had a great time though & this will always be a family favorite restaurant.

y82-9_Oae7hWUhfoLi7zCg.text: Waite staff was outstanding.   My wife and I had two entrees that are difficult to prepare; sauerbraten and roulade. Both were wonderful except for being somewhat dry. Sauerbraten was probably not marinated long enough (needs 5 days).  Roulade should have been browned and then extremely slow roasted.  Black Forest cake was very good and different, just not the best.

i66Me7n81EaYYIhTlqMpJw.text: Oktoberfest.  Live it.  Love it.  We've gone for my husband's birthday the past 2 years, and it has never failed to disappoint.  SO BUSY though, so book your reservations well in advance or you'll be waiting hours at the door.  The atmosphere is so fun and lively, and you wouldn't look a bit out of place in your lederhosen!  So drag it out of the closet!  I know you have a pair (a set?).    The food is, as the other reviews say, wunderbar.  Unbelievable saurkraut.  Pretzel bites are the bomb.  Sausage sampler, exquisite.  They have a special menu for the fest, and I haven't been back to try the non-fest-fare, but it seems to me like anything you pick would be a winner.  But hands down the best part of Oktoberfest?  The accordion guy.  He is the jam.  He played the Pennsylvania Polka for us Steeler fans, and it was magical (sorry QC peeps, you won't get that, and it's okay).  Just give this guy some love because he's awesome.  I'll post an update if I can ever make it back for Sunday Brunch!

J1vx5y_jYE8xyYSPHMi2VQ.text: Best authentic German restaurant around! I go there for lunch and dinner. They always have good specials that normally aren't on the menu. Be sure to join their Beer Club, and definitely check out the annual Oktoberfest.

okWogH8km9954eVOq02BKA.text: First visit.  I love this place.  The atmosphere is great, feels authentic, and is fun.  I had a sausage sampler that was very good.  My wife had crab cakes, the best she ever had, according to her.  My daughter had grilled salmon that was good, cooked just right, and tasty.  The menu is great with authentic German fair as well as standard American dishes.  The beer of course flows like water over Niagara Falls, and just as cold.  You really should visit this restaurant at least once, preferably in the month of October.

t7PNJtwiX9NaRwGO5LqhSQ.text: My suggestion to all restaurants:    Pick something to do, then be excellent at doing it.  Waldhorn does authentic German cuisine, and they are excellent at it! I joined their beer club during my first visit this week, which gained me a 0.5 liter stein, $0.50 off future beers in my stein, a cheap buffet full of yummy choices every Tuesday night, and other discounts that I can't remember.  All that for a one-time $28 membership fee.  Sold! The beer:  oh, man.  My favorites are the Spaten Dunkel and Oktoberfest.  They have Warsteiner, Paulaner, Tucher, and many other German staples.  This place is the real deal - the decor is very nice, the atmosphere is a European family-dining feel, and it just feels friendly.  The manager is super-nice, greeting everyone as they enter, telling us about future events, current specials, and other choice info.  All the servers are delightful, and I will be back here many times. I'll have to space out my visits, though; German food is HEAVY! I had the jagerschnitzel (my absolute favorite German dish); they did me right!  Like I said, they are excellent at what they do.  My compliments, Waldhorn.

2PGNDuRylQRAg-pHa-OuXA.text: I dislike when people give low reviews because of uncontrollable factors like other loud guests and too many people.  If it's a good place, you are gonna get both.  And it's a German restaurant for goodness sake.  Ever hear of Octoberfest?  It's not a quiet outing from what I've heard.  The food here is excellent.  From the sausages, to the breads, to the red cabbage, etc.  I have yet to really have a meal I didn't like.  I usually take a good look at the special, since it's usually pretty reasonably priced, and a good mix as well.  I admit the no more free pretzel rolls sucks.  But you know what else sucks?  The economy.    The selection of beer and wine is pretty good as well.  Usually we go with a big group, and the next time I go, I will make an effort to keep my voice down.  LOL.  If you're looking for good German food in Charlotte, hit it up!

HgBSnAhkv0nPfv51nlCXqA.text: So I've yet to go to the Waldhorn for lunch or dinner?  Why, then, am I reviewing it, you ask?  The answer: OMG brunch buffet.  Ok, so at $16 and change, the weekend brunch buffet isn't cheap. But it is plentiful and delicious. Omelettes are made to order (and made well, at that), and there smorgasbord of other selections: everything from pasta to rice to sausage to cake.  Of special note are the sausages and the red cabbage. Especially the red cabbage. If you think cabbage can't be so good as to give you daydreams, well, you haven't had the cabbage here. Even a brunch attendee native to Germany agreed with me on that.  The staff is friendly and attentive (even though we were difficult and changed tables!) and the decor is entertaining.  The only reason they don't get 5 stars is because I haven't experienced a full-service meal here yet.  I suspect that is just a matter of time, however.

iAMXgzqBqPBa0vUtpnaF7A.text: I thought this would be a great spot for Father's Day since Dad hadn't yet found a German restaurant in Chatlotte. He loved it, but apparently Father's Day is popular! Everything on the menu is good and they have a nice German beer selection. I highly recommend for anyone craving some wurst! Worth the drive.

iTrQRI0lusHydbV2iSHSDQ.text: We haven't been here is years. Just recently moved back to Charlotte and to my surprise the food is still amazing and the beer is still cold .

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. More Spaten Premium Lager
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

fXstBrH386k8LssTDSqHJA.text: I haven't had their full menu but the if their Sunday brunch buffet is any indication- I'm in for a treat!   They serve the brunch buffet on Sundays only up till 2:30 pm. It was a marvelous spread. There's something for everyone.   The breakfast items include an omelet station made fresh to order, bacon, cheese grits and my favorite- French toast. There's a hint of cinnamon in the French toast and it's dusted with powdered sugar. They're cut into strips for easy dunking into the warm syrup - just perfect. I could eat an order of just the French toast alone.   Entrees included wild rice, meatloaf, baked pasta, tortellini in cheese sauce, veggies like broccoli, green beans and sauteed zucchini and squash and a seafood dish of salmon, shrimp and scallops and fresh carv d toast beef with horseradish sauce. Since they're a German restaurant, they also have typical German fare that I personally love. Variety of sausages, sauerkraut, sauerbraten, spaetzle, red cabbage and pork with jager sauce. The sausages were perfect with the sauerkraut and the spaetzle was so light and fluffy - top It off with the sauerbraten and gravy - so yum yum.   There are also cold salads and German bread rolls, desserts, fresh fruit salad in a light syrup - oh my goodness. Just writing about all the food is making me wanna go back now!   I took off one star because a few of the dishes sat out too long and was cold. We went towards the end of the buffet time which may be why. Prime example is the sauerbraten. The first round was cold and the meat was dry and tough but they put out a new batch and It was amazing. With the sheer volume of diners during the brunch rush, they should keep fresh food out at all times. Other than that, I loved It. We're already planning to go back next week.

Cz0xzDdnus2DUEoM-qjeaw.text: This place is my favorite place to eat in Charlotte. The food is delicious and always nails the presentation. Their desserts are incredible and the whole atmosphere simply adds to the experience. I cannot recommend Waldhorn enough.

JpF4mxbbCah1A3tUuNH6RA.text: My favorite place to eat in Charlotte! The food is always perfect and the service is great! Thomas is the best bartender and Emily is a wonderful server!

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

POIreN9SSC63wIF0wyiEBw.text: Well, that was an unexpected surprise: delicious German food in NC. Everyone in my party was extremely satisfied with their meals. I had the sauerbraten and it was delicious, as was the spaetzle and red cabbage that came with it. The red cabbage was my favorite part of the meal - it was very flavorful, but not overpowering. Naturally, they had a great beer selection and they were very attentive to my coworker's gluten free needs. We walked here from a nearby hotel, which was a mistake, since NC doesn't seem to believe in sidewalks. Don't make our mistake. But do visit Waldhorn if you want delicious German food.

zFjqP2GHiMqsdrOrN8k8Mg.text: Who knew a German Restaurant would have the best salmon. Good food! Good beer! Fun family place!

xSvceq4t7KsYVWSBOdd-0Q.text: Wonderful German food. I grew up with a German mother. Some German restaurants don't live up to my mothers standard. This one excels. Service is wonderful as well.

Vj9wv7vOb4FVmTSSx9Yruw.text: Waldhorns is one of the best restaurant s in the Charlotte area. Authentic German foods combined with a knowledgeable professional and friendly staff make for a very good experience every time.  They have a great Sunday brunch with an omelette stand and all you can eat buffet of German selections that are hard to choose from. And then there is the Desert choices! During the week they have a beer club with many advantages and daily specials.

3nWxumbvqHh_gDsf2ue_rw.text: Amateur night level service during Saturday night primetime.  I want to like it more but it's arduous getting in and out with a group for such a simple dinner and it's not the kitchen's fault.    Front of house is a disaster.  They were really lost, knew nothing about beer list recommendations and had no system for making sure they were on top of things.  A different server came to our table every course and nobody knew what state our table was in.    The food is good but you practically have to beg for bread and drink refills while waiting for entrees.  It was an hour before we got bread and were still waiting for food orders.  Eventually had to have items they never brought taken off the check.    But they're good about splitting checks if you're in a group.  That was the silver lining.  I would go again for lunch during the week when it's not busy so I don't have to cringe at the mayhem I can't help do anything about.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Wurstplatte with home fries
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Schnitzel with fries

65yy8gdHUQ1ZYtO71a3oJg.text: I love the Waldhorn and it is such a treat when I get to go here. I recently went for lunch with some friends from work. First off, this is the only place I know with German food in the CLT area and it is authentic! The service is super friendly and attentive. They have a great selection of German beers to choose from. We shared the sausage appetizer which was surprisingly awesome. They were all a little different tasting and I enjoyed them all. I got the Wienerschnitzel lunch with spaetzle and red cabbage. The schnitzel is perfectly fried and comes out fresh from the fryer. I can't describe it any other way than absolutely delicious. Spaetzle is light and fluffy with a great taste. The cabbage was even awesome and I don't like cabbage. I will be back again. I hope to make it to their Sunday brunch one of these days, which I hear is AWESOME.

J_01EwTal-BCvRemy748FQ.text: I'm a sucker for German food and the waldhorn does it well. Being the only German restaurant around I find myself there quite often for someone who lives as far away as I do from there. Very good German fare albeit a bit pricey. Very cool ambiance and an extensive beer list. I definitely recommend their Sunday brunch where you can taste test many of their menu items off the buffet. If you're into German food I highly recommend.

VJktPcYuRQSudo12NyGc9w.text: Hands Down best German restaurant I've been to. Sauerbraten is delicious but I can not get over this spaetzle it is the best! Thier Oktoberfest is fun and food is great during that event. If your in the mood for great German cuisine this place is really worth the trip.

3SSxEYrwZ-dzi3XdRUhX_Q.text: Our family had a terrible experience at the Waldhorn Restaurant in Pineville, NC this past Sunday and thought you should know about it.  It was a special occasion for my dad, Murray White, and he selected the Waldhorn because it was his favorite place.  We had seven in our party and arrived about 11:15 knowingly without reservations. The hostess told us that it would be about an hour wait. We said we didn't mind the wait and would just hang out at the bar until our table was ready.  Within the first ten minutes we realized that an adult birthday party was occupying the majority of the large tables in most of the restaurant; about 60 people. We also noticed that they were through eating, and only two children were seated at a ten-top table closest to the bar. Other than their tables, only three other tables in the entire place would seat a party of seven or more. We continued to wait, and all three of the "non-party" tables turned once during the next hour. The party stayed on. At about an hour we checked with the hostess and she advised that they would get us a table soon. I remarked that the party group had been there for at least two hours and could they not ask them to free up one of the tables that they weren't using. The hostess was rather young and chose not to interfere with this group. After we had been there almost 90 minutes the hostess informed us our table was ready and our waitress led us to the table. We were seated and put in our drink orders and were told to head to the brunch buffet.  When we returned they had relocated our jackets, pocketbooks, etc to a booth that barely fit six people and put a small chair at the end. Needless to say it was cramped for us and my father had to sit on the end and was basically out in the aisle. He had to move every time someone walked buy or one of us had to exit the booth.  We protested this treatment to the manager on duty, and she was barely apologetic. She told us the other table was for a group that had reservations. Basically said the next time we come we should have a reservation. Almost insinuated that it was our fault for somehow inconveniencing them on that day. I explained that we realized we didn't have a reservation; however, when you are told it will be an hour wait and after an hour and half you are relocated into a cramped booth, that this was an unacceptable outcome for any restaurant. She just walked off like we were the problem. I asked her for a piece of paper and gave her my number and asked that the owner give me a call. Since Thomas and Gitta Maier are Fort Mill residents, I thought that they may like to hear first hand about how we were treated in their restaurant. Mrs. Maier called me today and said she was told she needed to call me. I explained all of the above and she was barely apologetic. At no point did anyone with this place understand that the situation could have been handled better. At no time did anyone at this restaurant offer any accommodation or extend an invite to my dad to make this terrible experience better.  I reviewed their ratings on several online sites and it appears that this practice by the owners is commonplace. Also seems the attitude of the owners filters down to their staff.  I can assure you that neither I, nor anyone else in our group, will pass through the doors of the Waldhorn anytime in the future.  If you want good German beer, adequate service, average German food, and total disrespect from the management of a restaurant, then this is your place. Trust me...you can do a lot better!!!

CFNp798LrdzheHBuceeXEQ.text: Sunday brunch is delish! Not an exorbitant amount of items but everything is cooked to perfection. My dad and daughter loved the assorted sausages. I LOVED the purple cabbage. Very attentive waiter and the chef making omelettes is very nice. My favorite dessert was the berry cobbler. We will definitely go back.

uO8YTHMrZec9jO0EFCSPrA.text: This is the closest you will get to authentic Bavarian food in North Carolina. I have been very satisfied each time I visit the Waldhorn!

s3kPBgU2QBcvDjNr4TagVw.text: My hubby has been wanting to try this place for awhile. I was skeptical but since he got thr recommendation from someone at work, I gave in. We came for Sunday brunch. We had the buffet.  The food was well seasoned and plentiful. The coffee was SUPER STRONG and amazing! Our server told us it was a European blend! The buffet itself has lots of food. Where it falls short is the overall presentation and decor. The decor is dated and the food presentation reminds you of a cafeteria style place.   Service was EXCELLENT! I was very pleased. My husband and father are still raving about the place and plan to go back.  I wasnt as impressed but I'm glad I tried something different.

e8re4u3EJVsVQ6f5dpu7Pw.text: My family met for dinner here last night (2/18)...  Making a reservation over the phone for a party of 12 couldn't have been easier...   We've been coming to Waldhorn over the years for special occasions, and yesterday was no different... I really enjoyed the meal I had... it's lent so they're doing a special menu called Maultaschenfest... it's like a German version of ravioli... little pasta pillows stuffed with beef and herbs... the long menu is all of the different ways you can have them served (sauces, etc...)... I had the hunter's sauce which is basically a mushroom cream sauce... it was DELICIOUS!!  The beer was fresh, the service was excellent, and our table was STUFFED by the end!  Lots of pretzel bread, yummy food and beer, and all topped off with apfelstrudel... It was a birthday meal to remember!  Thanks, Waldhorn!

oZCponvHoSM1i7uk_Jsehg.text: Absolutely terrible service. We called and they promised us a table before 6:00pm. When we arrived they told my family that it will be a half hour wait and we had a baby with us. The customers before us also made a reservation and they forgot as well. Can't trust these staff.

Wm69wyEsX7Mf8QH36LqxbQ.text: Me and my husband have been coming here for years. We always have good service and great food. The beer is pretty tasty as well. This trip I had the duck, highly recommend it. It was fall of the bone good. For our appetizer we had the puff pastry with goat cheese, I was not a fan but my husband ate it up. The atmosphere is very charming and the live music on Saturday is prefect.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

pqflCTpMRvIKGVG3se8Ohg.text: I always love the Waldhorn. The service is wonderful, and the food is excellent. The Wurst plate is my favorite; the sausages are always perfect and juicy.    I'd like to say the Sunday buffet is horrible to keep the place from being packed, but I can't. It's worth the 30-45 minute wait. I eat here whenever I can.

v5FtjuXpvo70ipc4Zd8fiQ.text: This is really the only German place in town. Been here several times. I grew up in Cincinnati which had a lot of German food so occasionally if I get a craving for a real bratwurst, I come here.   The outside is like a castle. Inside, there's a nice balance of wood accents that make you think you are in Germany for a second. The menu includes yes, beer, but also German classics like wursts, sauerbraten, spatzel and sTruedel along with sides of cabbage and German potato salad.  My latest visit, I was with a large group. I ordered sauerbraten which came with spatzele and cabbage. It's basically marinated beef with a dark sauce. The meat had a nice flavor. I absolutely adore the cabbage here. They use red cabbage and it has a hint of sweetness. The spatzele is light and fluffy and goes well with the sauce. And the pretzel rolls brought to the table are amazing.   Service is good. The only hiccup we had was separating the checks at the end, but overall a good experience. I've heard the Sunday buffet is great and want to check that out soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Sauerbraten

n88XE93aV2dpa1GySC8vlQ.text: Alles hat ein Ende, nur die Wurst hat zwei (Everything has an end, only the sausage has two)  Nope I don't speak German but I ate at Waldhorn last week...   From the outside it is like your going to a mountain chalet straight out of the German country side. Then you walk into an interior that reminds you of a run down Denny's. What in the world?!? Lack luster, cheap, no True decor... just blah blah and more blah. Just like so many people I know... good looking on the outside but dull and unimpressive on the inside!  You know that saying though... don't judge a book by its cover... well as far as this goes I'd say marvel at the cover, skip the intro, and dive straight into the "meat" of the story!  I started off with a bottle of German beer (See pics) that was touted as a dark smokey beer. It was astounding! Like opening a bottle of camp fire once the top was popped! It was smooth rich and loaded with Smokey goodness! I've never had a beer even close to this but it was fantastic!  There was a group of 9 of us and one that was German... and knew what he was doing.. he ordered aps for the table that consisted of potato pancakes with apple sauce and plates of 3 different sausages. The pancakes were ok... much better with the apple sauce but kind of unremarkable. The sausages were 3 different types of meat heaven! They were each very good in their own right. I literally could have stopped right there but in True gluttony fashion I moved on to the main course.  For me this course consisted of a stuffed Schnitzel. A hammered piece of pork, stuffed with Black Forest ham and Swiss cheese, and then fried. Each bite was tender, juicy and scrumptious!   At some point in the night we learned it was one of our parties 60th bday so a big piece of Black Forest cake was ordered for all to try: chocolate cake with cream icing and decadent cherry filling. Brought me back to my childhood as this was something my stepfather would buy us as a treat every now and then. Yummmmm.  The food was good... the service was kind of like that at a diner... nice but more like I was ordering a short stack with two eggs cracked and racked... at the local truck stop.   The Schnitzel makes it all worth it though... I have not had any this good since I was in Germany 15 years ago. Now I just need to find where I can get that beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Pancake ap

yQWj-JjwoPr_psES5g8b6A.text: Eeek... being from Europe myself I really wanted to like this place. We tried it twice and won't go back. We traveled to Germany countless times and I don't find this place very authentic or their food any good. It's not the cleanest inside either.

pv1m26SgRQ6m8fbyt3S_mA.text: Don't know what took so long, but I finally decided to check out this German restaurant for lunch today.    First of all, the outside of this restaurant looked fantastic (almost like a little German castle)! But once inside, a bit disappointing. Guess I expected the inside to match the outside, but it just wasn't that cute. Not sure how old this restaurant is, but it looked quite worn down...definitely in need of some upgrades and renovations. It could also use some overhead music...as the restaurant was way too quiet and unlively.  Despite the let-down in ambiance, the menu was quite enticing. A Schnitzel fan, I decided to try their signature "Wienerschnitzel". Surprisingly, most of my lunch mates went with American entrees, which had me worried for a moment. Fortunately, the Schnitzel (Breaded Pork Cutlet) was quite good...very thin and nicely breaded. Loved that it was on the dry side, and not so greasy. The brown gravy sauce was a bit bland for my taste, but I was quite happy with the breaded meat (and the healthy portion as well). Also, I really liked the "Spatzel" (German version of Noodles/Pasta). Think it might have been my first time trying this common German staple. Obviously, I haven't tried too many German foods. As for the red cabbage, I wasn't a big fan...but it definitely added more flavor to the Schnitzel.    The service was good (not great), but absent at times...especially near the end. Don't think I even got any Iced Tea refill.  Overall, I'm glad I finally decided to check out this place. In some ways, it was underwhelming, given how I heard so many good things about it, especially their brunch. Still, I did get my Schnitzel fix. Will probably return at least once more to check out their highly raved brunch, or maybe try them for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. &#34;Wienerschnitzel&#34; vom Schwein

kg2KreXxSPQU8PJjBRbbww.text: Surprisingly better than I thought, and I don't even like German food!? Very good service. You can sit at the bar and eat, it is first come first serve.  I ordered the vegetable strudle, it was very good. The pillow pasta soup was kind of blend, while the two small dumplings were good, the filling inside was rich. The soup was overpriced for the portion and what it had to offer. Came on a Friday night and the accordian man was out playing. Super pack during dinner time, be prepared to pack farther out in the back. You may have better luck with making a reservation.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

fwnmXd64-SP0ftscwyDKGg.text: My coworkers have been urging me to try the Waldhorn forever as we all work in uptown Charlotte and I finally got around to it today and WOW.  I mean, oh my God.    When you first pull up, you're immediately confronted with the authenticity of the restaurant -- the architecture is unmistakably German.    We were seated immediately, and greeted by a very friendly server.  I wanted to go for a draft beer or a special, but my coworker highly recommended the Aventinus doppelbock wheat ale and wow.  Though bottled, it was poured perfectly in a half liter glass and absolutely delicious.    As this was a lunch visit, we opted for the bratwurst sandwich with fries, along with an order of the weinerschnitzel with homemade spaetzle and red cabbage.  As a person of German heritage, I was completely blown away by the food.  The pretzel roll the bratwurst sandwich comes on, along with the sauerkraut and brown mustard are absolutely immaculate, to say nothing of the perfectly cooked bratwurst.  The fries are also perfectly done.    The schnitzel is fried beautifully, perfectly tender, and complimented perfectly by the gravy.  The spaetzel texture is very nice, and the red cabbage has a very sweet flavor that provides a great finish.    We ended the mean with the Apple Strudel and man am I glad we did.  It's amazingly crispy, with fresh apples and a delicious scoop of vanilla ice cream.  Make this your go to on the dessert menu.    I was expecting The Waldhorn to be good.  It was absolutely amazing and exceeded my expectations, which were high to begin with.  Please go.  Like, today.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

RZsKrRH7cwoM23cShnfUrw.text: I've been here a few times before. My most recent visit was for a friend's birthday. I can't say I'm a huge fan of German food, but I do think they do it pretty well here.   We were seated right away and the restaurant was not very crowded. They took our drink orders right away, but it did take a pretty long time for them to take our food orders.   We started with the Gebackener Ziegenkase appetizer which was pretty small, but tasted delicious. My favorite thing to get is the Schweizer Schnitzel which I got again this time. I love that it's stuffed with ham and cheese. My husband got the Waldhorn Sampler. The Schnitzel and Bratwurst were both pretty good, but I was not a fan of the Beef Roulade (it was dry and didn't really have flavor). The red cabbage that came with it was outstanding. It was sweet with a hint of cinnamon.   Overall it was a good experience and if you're looking for good German food in Charlotte, I recommend giving this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Gebackener Ziegenkäse appetizer

yxKlF-q5aWwH5DyyBi6pbA.text: Review of the Sunday Brunch Only  I'm normally a big fan of Waldhorn but have always been here for dinner  or for lunch but never for the Sunday Brunch.  Decided to give the Brunch a try one Sunday after Church.  We drove down from Cornelius and got there around 11:30 or so. Pleanty of parking and were promptly seated.  Granted for a Brunch, service except for the beverages is pretty much self serve.  The do not do table ordering during brunch so you're pretty much confined to the Brunch which is a shame because some of our favorite Schnitzels are not available for Brunch.  The offering are good and varied with normally something for everyone. Some polish mixed in as well.  Several of the pork offerings were excellent although the braised red cabbage left something to be desired.  One problem with a brunch with all the steam tables is that things tend to get dried out unless constantly replenished which was the case here.  All in all it was pretty good but being able to order from the much greater menu is so much better.  Would recommend but suggest for the maximum impact, try dinner or lunch when you can order off the regular menu.  Interior is beautiful with traditional German Motif.  Not a lot of German offering the the Charlotte area but this one is probably the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Exterior
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Entrance

x-YTnOhbkhVOBRkjkqPaPw.text: Good, but don't go on buffet days (Sundays). We have dined at Waldhorn twice. The first time was phenomenal. The service and food was awesome.   The second time was on Father's Day. We had reservations for 2:00 (they only had a 12, 2, and 4:00 seating). We waited 20 minutes (not terrible, I know) for our reserved table, and people who walked in without a reservation were seated right away.   They put us upstairs, which meant we had to walk down the stairs and across the restaurant to get to the buffet, a feat in itself if you have small children like we do.   The buffet itself was fine, though it didn't have Weinerschnitzel, which is one of the reasons my husband wanted to come here. The roast beef and brisket on the buffet was too tough and inedible. Everything else we got  was fine. I love their spatzle, pretzel rolls, and red cabbage. Their desserts were fine, but mainly frozen squares of different kinds of cakes and pastries that you can tell are not homemade.  Service was meh. We never got drink refills. The restaurant is a little run down. The AC vent kept leaking fluid on my kids' food and now that I think about it, this happened the last time we were there as well. We ended up moving to another table the first time, but the second time there were no other tables available. I just told my son to move his plate and try to eat leaning over to his left side.   I give 3 stars because our first visit was exceptional, but our second was definitely not.  If you want to go, don't go on buffet day. Make a reservation for a night you can order off the menu so the food will be fresher.

4sgZcsChl9O9tvOrBSgXOg.text: Three of us showed up on a Saturday night after making reservations 30 minutes earlier. Nice table near a gentleman wearing lederhosen, playing the accordion. We ordered German beers. They brought out fresh and hot pretzel rolls, delicious! I had the sampler platter which was Pork "Wienerschnitzel", Beef Roulade, and Bratwurst, served with homemade spatzle, red cabbage, and brown sauce. All three meats were very good, could not choose a favorite. The prices are reasonable, the service excellent and the atmosphere as if in Germany. Quite enjoyable dinner. The place was busy, many folks waiting to dine when we left around 7:pm.

s8CkRBlW486LmYd4wEhQow.text: We entered the front door to be greeted by a friendly hostess. She informed us of our wait, which was reasonable for a busy restaurant. We sat down to wait. As we waited there was a party that partial arrived thinking reservations at 6p and others had not arrived thinking 630p. They were told there was a party booked at 730p which only gave them an hour to eat/socialize. The restaurant looked at the books and was able to move reservations to 630p without a party booked behind them to allow them to eat/socialize. I thought that was going above and beyond to accommodate the parties misunderstanding. We were escorted to our seat (which was all the way next to a fire door and I froze my a.. off, I get making space count but come on insulate the door). Before we could sit down our server was at the table informing us of the specials and getting our drink order. She returned with our drinks and delicious pretzel bread rolls. We ordered the Waldhorn Sampler: Pork "Wienerschnitzel", Beef Roulade, and Bratwurst, served with homemade spatzle, red cabbage, and brown sauce. Everything on the sampler tasted good, except the slaw as i don't like beets. I got a side of sauerkraut and it was tasty. One thing I did not like was the food was dropped off by a runner and our waitress did not come back until we were done eating asking if we needed "to go boxes" before asking about dessert. Our drink glasses never got refilled.  Over all food was good so I will be back (kudos to the kitchen staff making the food), and I know to ask not to be put in the corner of death near the drafty emergency exit.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Waldorn Sampler

zryExjXK7csrPKAgAUYMXQ.text: I would say usually I enjoy this restaurant but tonight was really surprised by the fact that whoever prepared my ribeye steak decided that they should butterfly it. This should never be done without telling the customer. It is really not necessary to butterfly a steak when order done especially a ribeye. Would have said something in the restaurant but sometimes just not worth disturbing others in party.

I58WVe7JwRiyP2z5PXgB8w.text: We decided to try a new brunch spot and this place was super close to home. We didn't have a reservation so we had about a 25 minute wait. First off the waiting area is small and the cold air coming in every time the door swung open was brutal.   Our table was a big booth which is nice for my family of all boys and one girl, to spread out. The establishment is quaint and showing its age but it feels like a family owned biz. Servers were very busy flipping tables but prompt enough with drinks and refills.   The buffet offered variety including a bread table, hot double sided bar, cold station, omelette made to order and roast beef sliced to order.   For the price I'm not sure we will come back ($17.95 adults and $7.95 kids). They didn't ask if our kids were of age for the kids pricing (they look big but are 12 and 10) so we were charged for 4 adults.

6sue3u68_LDfmkAINZoUbA.text: Someone recommended the Sunday brunch to my folks and we decided to check it out the Sunday prior to Christmas. We did call ahead to see if reservations are needed, but they only take them if your party is 6 or more people. For smaller parties, they suggest you arrive early if you wish to be seated right away.   The exterior reminded me of something out of a storybook - very German architecture. Definitely recommend getting there early before opening as a lot of people had the same thought. (We got there about 10 minutes prior to opening and there were at least 4 or 5 groups hanging around the entrance waiting for the restaurant to open.)  The gals at the hostess stand let you know there is a limit for how long your party may dine with them for the Sunday brunch. (She told us an hour and a half, which was more than enough time for a small party of three adults.) I could see the limit being a bit tricky if you had a huge party dining with people of all ages that wanted to eat at their own pace.   We were seated right away and the waiter was pleasant and attentive. For brunch he worked with another waiter who maintained the bar area for drinks - both were great at making sure we had enough drinks and checking on us.   The brunch is a buffet with a mixture of German dishes, pasta, carving stations, and omelettes. They have desserts on a separate tray and a basket of fresh rolls. (The pretzel ones were incredible and reminded me of the pretzels I bought in Rothenburg many years ago.)  The sausages, potatoes, rolls, and pastas were great. I enjoyed almost everything I tried and the price was very reasonable.   I'd come back here again if I had a craving for a German breakfast.

aWh5lPZI2tXXb3LJKVBQ9g.text: Me and my family absolutely love this restaurant. The 12 of us came here for my dads 52nd birthday and everything was perfect! Food is always so consistent and delicious. Servers are responsive and fast. Deserts; we got chocolate mouse cake, apple strudel and vanilla ice cream. Amazing. I even went up to the owner and he was super kind to me and receptive. Definitely the best family oriented and comfortable restaurant! Pay them a visit for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

7PHD3jNw-f9XA9DjK2Gjsw.text: Always great food at Waldhorn. I love the various sausage plates, and the last time I was there had a great oven roasted duck. Wife loves the wienerschnitzel von kalb. The red cabbage is always flavorful and tender.  And I love the pretzel rolls.  The service is occasionally less than stellar, especially when the restaurant gets full, as people like to come here in large parties.  Also it is very easy for my wife, young son and I to drop 100$ for a meal here, especially if you're having more than one beer.

h8-wlj0vJ7bsH3Il44hIGw.text: We were in Pineville last weekend for a shopping trip at Zygma's Polish Store. We looked around in Yelp for a good place for lunch and decided on Waldhorn.   The atmosphere is great. It's like you've been transported to Germany. They've got a decent - though basic - selection of German beers. I especially like the Beer Club. Too bad I live so far away.   Our girls had the kid's sausage plate. They both ate all of their food. My wife had the mushroom sauteed pork over spatzle. I have the schnitzel with hunter's sauce and spatzle. Both were good.   Overall, Waldhorn was enjoyable. We may go back for Oktoberfest. Otherwise, I wouldn't go to Pineville just for this.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Beer Club!
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Mushroom Sautéed Pork
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Outside

tuJt1cOM-uzO5gMUTsKpRg.text: Great and authentic.  To start with the last first, their desserts are off the chart awesome.  Traditional German food, properly prepared, served correctly with average service.   A bit more expensive than it should be, thus the 4 stars. Also, they have to direct traffic during Oktoberfest.   Worth the time, the drive and the money

Im1OTZk50Z8A0ndczN275Q.text: One of the best restaurants in Charlotte. Authentic German food and atmosphere. The Rinderfilet Stephanie is delicious.

ZRo32Fcx5dUZjqXViVqFgw.text: Love this place for German Food.   Have to try the Sunday Brunch next time. Heard it was very good.

tTjel10o68jam_pbcaK5yg.text: solid place.  excellent beer selection.  food is very good. prices are decent.

Ja9mWx3BqBhaaFXH54LQyg.text: Very frustrating when a business is not open when yelp says it is.  Came on Sunday at 5.

XjWcY6Miz9H8VWV9x-hTqQ.text: Went for our 47th Anniversary. Food was great and the service was excellent. This was the second time we have been here but won't be the last.

l8vdm5FIfAmSFywran4Vqg.text: I'd been wanting to come here a long time and made it finally. But, oh, it is so, so bad. I didn't realize we could only do the buffet for lunch. It was 16.95 and I feel like I ate $4.00 worth of really horrible, cheap food. I'm not real picky but, my gosh! Some people will eat anything if it's on a buffet.

ZFiprMlV0ZeTvHTKQvdOTA.text: This place was fantastic for my 35th birthday, I started off my meal with a large mug of Bitburger which is a pilsner brought out out by are friendly German waitress. I very excitedly ordered my entree the famous Rinderfillet "Stephanie" which is a fillet mignon wrapped in bacon and puff pastry covered with a bearnaise sauce. Served medium rare and perfectly cooked for my liking. I sampled several knock wurst and bratwurst off my friends plates and again perfectly cooked. The sides we had were spatzel and home fries which really filled us up. For desert I was given a Black Forest cake with cherry filling and whip cream delicious I tell ya. I can see why this place is currently ranked #4 in German restaurants in the United States. Spectacular meal with great service in a quiet setting and no loud polka music to disturb me while I'm feasting like a King of old !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Awesome bread
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Black Forest cake w cherry filling
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

mw-7PbcUnaZ9Wq2xR5rYWw.text: Waldhorn.... man, one of my top 5 favorites so far in Charlotte, if you're looking for German food, Don't look anywhere else, this is your place.   Upon Arriving I found out this place is pretty big, we (guy group) came on a Friday night at 7, the Best POSSIBLE time to eat dinner, Right? surprisingly as packed as this Restaurant was, we only waited 15-20 minutes which REALLY surprised me. the mood Here is awesome with a gentleman walking around playing the accordion and entertaining the children, and a lot of the rest of us.  We ordered and a little bit later were served some dinner roles, which I'm always a fan of, but these weren't any dinner roles, these were PRETZEL dinner roles. Dangerous!, don't eat too many! Warm Butter also comes with it.   Onto the entree, I ordered the Schweitzer Schnitzel, In English, its a Breaded Pork Chop, STUFFED with Black Forest Ham and Swiss Cheese. served with Spatzle (Egg Noodles) and Brown Sauce/Gravy. so Think Cordon Blue except better, melts in your mouth and you can clearly taste all the flavors but they fit together really well.   Cons,  The only thing I can think of was maybe have a couple more waiters, but over all, Very Pleased.

Byfe3iwlVNU9TLCGKn98Lg.text: I must say that this restaurant provides a simply superb dining experience. Their sausage sampler provided an exquisitly wonderful world of sausages and sauerbraten. To end this fabulous feast i partook of one of their amazing desserts, most of which i carried back to the hotel to eat later as i was seriously stuffed.

lfYrLM6WrN8MyZas9aVWSw.text: Not only is everything I have ever had here been very tasty, but I also appreciate how seriously they take my food allergies. This is one of my go to places to take out of town guests or anyone wanting to try German food.

hRSixYIABmFBWii-aEBvKg.text: We think this is one of the best restaurants outside of Germany! Had to come one last time before we leave Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Grapefruit Hefeweizen, yum yum

lxJpFMIDVyJESuZZstvxUg.text: The service is really great. Our waiter was on top of it all night.  On Tuesdays, they have this buffet and drink special for club members. It's a $30-$50 fee to get reduced pricing on drinks and food.  I gave it a 3 star because they violated a few rules of plating.  Rule number one, never plate anything that can't be eaten.  They throw large sprigs of rosemary on all their dishes like an ornament.  It can't be eaten, it has no value there.  They also garnished the plate with green herbs.  The herbs were all on the rim of the plate and seemed just a bit sloppy.  The food isn't spectacular, it was very bland and could have tasted better. Last and not least I thought Germans were known for their desserts.  I've been to German restaurants where I've been blown away by the countless desserts they had and how rich they were.  Waldhorn has limited dessert and the chocolate cake we had felt like something I could have bought at Harris Teeter.  Service is great but food, presentation, and dessert portfolio have to improve.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

BtkRClWlPDdHH5oQjrRFzA.text: We live far away from this place, but whenever we visit Charlotte I always have to come here. It is by far my favorite restaurant and they have a very comfortable atmosphere. I haven't found another place with better real German food outside of Germany. I would recommend this to everyone; kids to adults. The accordion player here is always amazing and fully decked out in a lederhosen!!!

wJgskSGKkzvgEry2eIxFxw.text: Five hours at Quail Hollow, at the WFC, left us thirsty, hungry and thirsty! With world class beer choices and the finest German Cuisine you'll find in the 704 this is a great choice any night! My bride ordered the "Weinerschneitzel Vom Kalb" with a minor twist to the sides. She wanted the Spatzle and red cabbage which was not a problem!!  Ate every mouthful. My Sauerbraten was delicious, as usual and the beer was FANTASTIC! The WALDHORN has great ambiance, attentive Service Team and a great place to decompress after a busy day! Nice people serving great food and world class beer what else might you want? Guten Appetit!

sUeUH8lVQ_1yHNuFQMdFaA.text: German or not, this food is amazing!  Service was killer too!  I have been here twice. Once for my birthday (random) and once for a Magellan Society meetup. Both times we had a large group, 10-17 people, and we had caring, competent service plus unbelievably wonderful, authentic German food.  The owners are great to work with especially if you have a large group. They were a dream. And the wait staff went above and beyond to work with our unique requests.   I would recommend making the trip no matter where you live!  Thank you, Waldhorn!

CpKRDMgx-KQ_UzzgwSFWxA.text: This is a terrific German restaurant. The real deal!  The beer flight (pick your own) was great. The food better and Sharif the waiter awesome! We ordered  apple strudel even though we knew we were stuffed. Unbelievable .  Also must mention the traveling according player was a treat. Best spaitzel anywhere

F3FgZy5s_Oxolr4VpNbJ9w.text: Good selection of German beers. Had the sausage platter. They were good and potatoes cooked right. Desert was chocolate mouse and it was presented well and tasty.  Server was very attentive and professional. Sometimes that is hard to find. Second time here and would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

4XWKWaQrTTI7B8rFMq-mdg.text: Yes, this place is huge but you still need to call ahead because they are busy. ( even at 5:00!) They don't take reservations for parties under 6. Parking lot is large so, no problem there.   Best German food I this area, for sure. We had to wait for our table so we had the sausage appetizer at the bar; bratwurst,  veal sausage, and knot wurst I had the potato pancakes, light and fluffy-red cabbage slaw and potato salad. My husband had the wiener schnitzel and the whole basket of the pretzel rolls.    My husband joined the beer club-$30 and a stein. They have a club that meets on Tuesdays with a $6.95 buffet. And .50 off beers in the stein. We plan on trying that and the Sunday buffet the other Yelpers mentioned.

hdvQeduuHYt2vw36AHXvJA.text: As someone who has lived in Germany and had authentic German food and constantly looks for American German restaurants this was a big let down. I have several complaints. The buffet contained non- German food like pastas and penne and American food (this is always a bad sign) because real German restaurants have only German food.  I have had my fair share of rotkohl and sauerbraten and other German foods, I tried their sauerbraten, rotkohl and sausage and was incredibly disappointed, it was lacking that signature German flavor and tasted like it came from a can. It was all flavorless and I couldn't even get through a 1/3 of my plate. The rotkohl was mushy and the sauerbraten was mushy, just no wrong wrong wrong. I have to say also, it was $16 for the buffet (these are lunch prices) and $5 for a 1/2 liter beer, very overpriced for a poor attempt at German food.  The waitstaff are very unprofessional all standing around and talking loud near your table. I dined alone and so I sat alone, they sat at a vacant table across from me talking loud and being rude. It was approaching 2:30 which is when they close so they starting closing up shop and guests were still in the dining room: vacuuming, cleaning, laughing amongst themselves all while guests were trying to enjoy their meals. I have been to mediocre, average and incredible German restaurants and this gets 1 star from me. I drove 45 minutes for overpriced "German" food. I will not be coming back at all. The dessert didn't taste German at all, carrot cake and stuff like from a grocery store bakery. If your cooks aren't German or aren't experienced in making German food then you shouldn't be a German restaurant. Also, I did not see curry wurst anywhere. What German restaurant doesn't have currywurrst? Auf Weidersehen, adieu and goodbye. No thanks.

_6HYVwBcDyZsbg2JL55XbA.text: I was impressed with the timeliness of our server. The food was good except the brocolli, it wasn't seasoned. Bread is the best and the entrees were good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Serving size is pediatric bordering neonatal.lol
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. The meal serving sizes were generous.
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

2aEeXqiz7LGyyCUgUNujug.text: This is a great place for authentic German food and ambiance. The owners put a lot of effort into making this feel German, even down to the architecture and landscaping.   The service is good, but the commitment is great. If there's an issue, they want to make it right. The food is delicious. Definitely try the desserts and dessert adult beverages. And the beer, obviously.  This is also a great place to go for the World Cup games when Germany is playing. The place gets packed and loud.

cNTKd53yXRgcjeMbZwc4gA.text: If you're looking for EVERYTHING German this is the spot. From decor and food to drinks and the staff's language skills and knowledge. It's a pretty awesome transition in atmosphere as soon as you walk in the door. The food is delicious as well - couldn't pronounce much of it, but tasted great!  Best tip about this place: The staff's knowledge and understanding of all German heritage. I asked about a million questions about the menu and traditions and this server was spot on!

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. menu front
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. side salad
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. something with chicken - yumm!!

NPncCejhwSQYCemkQ_S9AQ.text: Have you ever been to Germany? I lived there for 4 years and the food here competes with the food I had there. Everything from the salads, bread, and beer all the way to the main dish were amazing. Highly recommend.

xCDVBxwmB4iHr4A1QvgMUg.text: Love, love this restaurant!!' Awesome German food and service was wonderful!  Ask for Nick!!!  Several first timers with us and they can't wait to come back!   The accordion player made our night!!!

Ob6_Dx2-AMyu7VINVIOYlw.text: My favourite German restaurant. A piece of Bavaria! Great staff and food quality. You should try the Sausages

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Schwäbische Wurstplatte

U71f5NkIJi5lUIagahhxkA.text: We have moved away from Charlotte. We will miss Waldhorn very much. We have enjoyed the Sunday brunch and they have my favorite German beer. Hofbrau dunkel. The rouladen is almost as good as my mothers.

w-H81eIliBOkv6phwea5FQ.text: This Restaurant is absolutely amazing!!  The bratwurst sandwich is absolutely heavenly with its delicious sauerkraut and great sausage.  My favorite desert is the apple strudel. I would highly recommend this restaurant because they have bunnies for sale

DoUel_FeJ1QDC4GrcIgxeA.text: The pretzel rolls and potato pancakes are amazing! Service was spectacular A+! First timers with no German background or experience and was highly impressed. The scenery, music, and ambiance was great. Definitely a hidden gem and worth a try :) we'll be back for sure. Great bar and drinks too, nothing disappointed.

62i3kill3VX7gmtcLtzLYw.text: First time last weekend at the Waldhorn an was not disappointed.  The menu selection was good and the food was excellent.  The wurst appetizer with the kraut was enjoyed by our whole table and all the different plates and dessert was very good.    Nice to have a little accordion music in the weekends, too.  Staff is very friendly and helpful.

T2S8tDprVs-L76zU2JqVlw.text: At the end of a lovely visit with our German friends, we went to the Sunday brunch at Waldhorn to try all the traditional dishes and see if  Our friends found them to be authentic. The answer was a resounding yes! From the cucumber salad to the red cabbage, the sausages, Sauerkrauts and pork dishes were perfect. We stayed until 12 so we could have a Spaten as well.  The added bonus was several breakfast and 'american' items were also served, so our kids could try new things, but also have some familiar dishes as well.  We will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

kb3D8cemjgW_gqnaivkZbg.text: After looking at the website and then going to Waldhorn for the first time, we were pleasantly surprised. The website doesn't do the restaurant justice. The decor is very German and has a nice family atmosphere.   The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. We ate the wienerschnitzel and veal with mushrooms over pasta. Both dishes were exactly what we expected. My husband being german, we had high expectations.  The fries were great especially dipped in mayonnaise.  He had the Paulaner Hefeweizen  1/2 liter and felt like he was in Germany.    I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a good german meal at a reasonable price. We did not have any complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Rahmgeschnetzeltes mit spaetzle
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Wienerschnitzel mit pommes frites und rotkihl
Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States. Impressive!

YFau-yESDenvGDKDPQRaFA.text: First time in, lunch on a Saturday around noon.  No wait for seating, server was friendly.  The potato pancakes and applesauce were a great starter.  I had the bratwurst, that pretzel roll is terrific, very soft and fresh, not too think and not chewy at all.  It's a really great brat.  I also had the German potato salad for a side but was too full to eat it, it was much better than other versions I have tried.  I read about their Sunday brunch while I was there, seems like a great way to check out more of their menu.    The one negative thing is, it was pretty cold and drafty so I had to leave my light jacket on while I ate, and found myself wishing I had worn a heavier one.  Perhaps it was just the area where we were seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Waldhorn Restaurant - Pineville, NC, United States

HnSLBOuTqC0uc0ovC8ctIw.text: The Waldhorn is just a fun place with awesome, authentic German fare. I've visited for lunch and dinner and enjoyed every dish I've tried. Don't skip on the heavenly pretzel rolls.    Make sure to visit their Oktoberfest celebration. Bring your own Liter steins and dance to the music of a live band.

MJtcmxdw0KRyE4jP1FHdxQ.text: We visited for brunch this past Sunday, it was reasonable at $16 and included a ton of different (tasty) options. It's not one of those buffets that are gross and unattended, all of the food was very fresh. My husband was a very happy man, and overall we left pleasantly stuffed Augustus Gloop-style.   My favorites; the pretzel rolls with mustard, sauerkraut, and surprisingly the desserts...all of them!

Hxlmu_6f2br0VAb0oE4tyQ.text: This is about as authentic of a German restaurant as you can find around here. They have a great selection of beer, many of which are difficult to find elsewhere. The food is always great, though beware the after effects of overindulgence in red cabbage. If you're looking to try German cuisine or already love it, this is the place to sate your desires.

fPXDNhza8QWWVBXn6XJI2g.text: Absolutely delicious German food...Bavarian vibe.  My favorite is the Schweinschnitzel (breaded pork loin)...I get extra brown sauce.  If you are not a purist, you can get something besides the red cabbage...but why???  Their spaetzle is very good as well.    The management is very attentive.  Sometimes they have a wandering accordion player to serenade you (after 7...perhaps only on weekends...not sure).  Don't go in hoping for high brow...you will be disappointed, but if you want something that takes you to Germany...this is the ticket.  I am always happy with my meal and love to bring friends.

vPyd0O_G2yVziKEbHdKBpg.text: Amazing food, service and music! 10/10 definitely will be coming back soon. The best schnitzel in Charlotte but I don't have anything to compare it to!

HZhIfJCHq4bWdTTzs3nM5g.text: Took my 96 year old dad here for lunch.  He wanted potato pancakes without looking at the menu.  We ordered them and he LOVED them.  Said they were the best he has had and wants to go back for more.  I had a very nice veal and mushroom "stew" on top of Spatzle, the German home made egg noodles.  They were excellent and when I gave some to my dad he said that next time he wants a large bowl of Spatzle with butter and salt.  No, he is not really easy to please, but the Waldhorn pleases him and that pleased us.

1CBsoTJeheJq3qrzHEPWXg.text: Authentic food. Great staff, very friendly. Many people are locals and are regulars. Even their desserts are yummy!

dqkjzTPh1oCmsPmvdsm6pQ.text: Unreal German food in a decent environment with excellent service! I also love the plethora of German beer. It is sooooo good! I had the Rindsrouladen... Braised Beef Rouladen stuffed with bacon, onions and pickle. It was delicous in every way.The side items were Spatzle and red cabbage... also excellent. A pleasant surprise was the house salad. Ridiculously good. Fresh mixed greens. Perfect amount of dressing. and underneath in four little piles were surprises of carrot, pasta, cabbage, and another Item I have forgotten. All delicious little piles. Like gifts! Oh, and I almost forgot the BREAD! Good God! The pretzel rolls with a little butter are otherworldly. I want to come back here so bad ... but living in KC it is going to be a while.

5IitLNsIEgUjLWfvY5mEcA.text: Waldhorn never fails to provide the best food! I've been at least once per month in the last year and a half, and I have ordered the same meal every single time. The wiener schnitzel is amazing!! On the menu it's called Schweineschnitzel "Wiener Art" and it comes in two different sizes depending on your hunger level, and always comes with a side of spatzle and red cabbage. If you're not familiar with schnitzel, it is a flattened, breaded, and fried piece of pork (with a veal option available if you're interested) and it will come with a brown sauce over the top. Save room for dessert because the Black Forest cake & apple strudel are so fresh and delicious. Waldhorn also offers beer specials throughout the week which pair nicely with the schnitzel.

nsxPzm3h0vjoHbOaO7US7g.text: Used to come here a lot, but haven't been back as much because it's a little out of the way for us now.  My work had an event for Oktoberfest, and I have never had better service, especially when being part of a big group. They have great, interesting beers, and the food is interestingly tasty!

Ni071S1q5vH6UjqoORBs5g.text: Always enjoy their Sunday buffet.  Just wish I could get a table, but it does bode well when the restaurant is full of customers.  The best German food I've had since I was in Germany.

pFDD81gbtsD7tbvUpKUetg.text: Jenna took great care of us! Food and service was top notch! 10/10 Jenna, congrats on the new job!

pqUMzUn77maQFofhw_VnEA.text: The 1st time I have ever ate at this location. You really have to enjoy german food in order to appreciate some of the dishes that is server on the brunch buffet during Sundays. The food that I ate was very tasteful and I really enjoyed being there. During their sunday brunch they will also make omlets on demand with all sorts of different fillings and toppings.

yR07otNY7-lH1PrHt73oMg.text: Fairly authentic german food. Great atmosphere. Liked it more before I actually went to Europe and had actual german food. Never going to be quite the same but I still love it! Good place to go for something different and tasty!

AjNCTgg5y1TII8C4wVV3Bg.text: Fabulous place!!!   Went during Queens Feast Restaurant week and it was very organized and accommodating . Food and staff could not be better! Definitely will come back!

mTDYHx4bXwImGKoLAtHS_w.text: Yay!  Good German food in Charlotte!  Traveling accordion player.  Attentive service.  Jagerschnitzel.  Pretzel rolls.  Need I say more?

nai_l1osGRsJBsW_Evve3w.text: We had a dinner reservation for 19 people on one of the busiest weekends of the year. The food, service and staff were excellent.

NYjI-BYmE_72rwnxUaMcYw.text: It was the best meal I have had in weeks. Friendly staff, incredible desserts and very quiet witch I liked.

7kCxoiDtW9yse5XJSElf0A.text: Just came back from their Sunday Brunch. It was about $15 per person unless you have kids under 4 which are free. The brunch is a great way to try a lot of items in one sitting. They have an omelet station which was decent but I came for the German food. Also at the omelet station was roast beef which was just OK. They have about 30 other lunch items on the buffet. The best part by far is the dessert section which included about 10 additional items. It was not the best German I have had but I would not expect that from a buffet. I will be back to try a menu item another day.   The staff was very friendly and the building had a great German feel.

fRsmNwjOoIpzBtEt7EtEPw.text: My wife and I had our wedding reception here last month and we can't sing their praises enough!  They made it so easy for us so we could focus our attention on everything from actually getting married to coordinating out of town guests joining us.  The staff was helpful, good-natured, seem to be enjoying themselves as much as our guests (our reception was a little unconventional).  Oh, and did I mention the food?  The sausage combination was juicy and delicious, the veggies were crisp and delicious, the pork loin was so tender and the sauce was creamy and tangy, the salad options were all that you could expect from a fine German restaurant (make some extra room for the red cabbage especially), and of course the delicious spatzle made the meal just all we could've hoped for.  If you haven't been here yet, might I suggest checking out the Sunday brunch buffet first to get a good feel for what they have to offer.  This place will hold a special place in our hearts for taking so much stress out of our big day.  :-)

wXIi3BmbtMvDB9YZDAF7CQ.text: You know a place is good when the servers are enthusiastic about the food themselves. Great dinner with dessert of Apfelstrudel - fantastic. Service solid and efficient, smiles all round. Should have been busier though, they deserve to be

yO6Yl77RKnmCbclz-Fpjqg.text: Stopped here on way from Charlotte airport.  Good food and very tasty; there are really big servings here too.  Great beer selection though I am not much of a drinker.  The Chocolate chip cheesecake is extremely tasty.

oYnHxqWHeM1_Ol6gSHZREA.text: Been to Germany? If not, then go. If yes, then no. When I think of German food, I think of the smells of Frankfurt Am Main or the hip little Back Factory spots around Berlin. This place lacks something, it may be Germans. I dunno. Spend 30 bucks on 8 euros worth of food. Do the math it doesn't add up.

p_susMtNkaWW3WYJ4tA1WQ.text: Went for the buffet on Sunday.  As another reviewer said it was set up weird.  Grew up on German food and this didn't compare. Probably good for a restaurant though. Should try ordering from the menu it might be better.

8IzR95EGM1qd_WydsXyVEQ.text: I am a fan of the beer selection, and beer selection only- they have a great mix of really good German beer and seem to rotate it seasonally. As for the food, it's not fair for me to comment- I just don't care for German cuisine.

ija-qbFtKurP01rKnBwO8g.text: Went there as I was visiting my parents, they took me here for dinner and first weekend of Oktoberfest.  I recall having a great German meal about 14 years ago and its always been in my "top 5 meals ever" memory, and this place met and surpassed it. We ordered the smoked trout appetizer to get going and nibbled on that with the pretzel rolls dropped off on our table.  Both were great. We had a great server who recommended the beer (a dark wheat, can't recall the exact name) and the sampler plate. I shrugged off the sampler plate as too easy a selection, but went with it anyway.  It was phenomenal - noodles, the sauce, the brat, the rouladan (sp?) meat thing, and pork slice was so tasty. Servings were huge, none of us finished it. After dinner we got free passes to the beer tent outside, headed there for more beer and great band for few hours. Overall, great happy employees, great food, and just a wonderful evening, worthy of the 5 stars.

eoomQaQPbPRiiq2vUxvtXg.text: Went for dinner. Sat down in a nice booth with a "CIA interrogation room" light bulb for lighting. Please take the wattage below 100 watts   Ordered a sausage variety appetiser, sure would have been nice to know which ones were which (for future reference).  Dinner rolls were free.  I enjoyed my Ribeye steak. I can't speak for the others around the table. If you know you're going to eat German food and you know it's going to be "heavy" food, then you should enjoy this restaurant. Beer selection is great.  I will return to drink more beer and try more food specials. Overall its good food but the cost might keep me going back frequently.

tWy9gWDk0_rEjYs8aChmRg.text: Full disclosure here, I'm part German, I'm married to a German, I've traveled to Germany once and I really love beer. Ok, so we hit up Waldhorn last night for my dad's 75th birthday and Oktoberfest. We had dinner inside before moving out to the tent. We got some apps to start, potato pancakes & a brats tray. The pancakes w/ apple sauce were fantastic, nice & crispy edges too. Brats were Brats, excellent. I also enjoyed the sauerkraut. For the entree, I ordered the Sauerbraten. It was ok. I didn't care for the spatzle, it was just a little soft for my liking but the red cabbage was tasty & the beef had good flavor but a little over cooked. Next time, I'll go with the brats! For dessert I had the apple strudel. Now this is a dessert!! I'll go back just for the apple strudel anytime, it was that good!  Full of flavor w/ a nice sprinkle of cinnamon on top of everything, including the ice cream. Great presentation too! After dinner we moved to the tent. As some of the others have said, there were lines everywhere. Since we had dinner there, we got into the tent for free but still had to stand in line to buy beer tickets and then another line to buy beer. They moved pretty quickly. Oh, the beer was awesome. I was drinking the Oktoberfest. Lots of people under the tent and all around and everyone was having a good time. All in all, we had great time and it's as close to Germany as you'll find in the Charlotte area.

GlHjDAfunlmjeuIwGMQ1fQ.text: Due to my job I travel weekly and eat out a ton so I'm pretty hard to impress.  With that being said I LOVE this place!  Every time I go the food is great and the beer is awesome.  If you have never tried the Waldhorn you should check it out, I think you will be impressed.

Z6kQW4C9gUpc9ujP_kUirA.text: My daughter and I love this restaurant and we're not even close to being German. LOL.  Our waitperson, Annette, was wonderful. I tried a different dish today and didn't like it (not used to some German foods I guess) although I did like the sides. Long story short, the manager did not charge me for my entree.  I did not ask him to do that. We had the apple streusel with ice cream for dessert. It is to die for. We love the sausage appetizer.  We will definitely return. Great atmosphere too.

_4FAOvXhPoRYVcMZyc-q-A.text: This place is yummy!  We had great food and wonderful service.  Admittedly I am not completely familiar with GERMAN food, but I am familiar with GOOD food, and this food was GREAT!  The flounder was spot on!  And the bread pudding?  Mmmmm, salivating just thinking about it!  The kids really enjoyed their ice cream clowns and now I just need to come up with another excuse to go back to Waldhorn.  We live too far out to be regulars!  Bummer!
